analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o // 'khrugs pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o // le lo dang dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with immorality.🔽He does not generate a mind that is associated with agitation.🔽He does not generate a mind that is associated with laziness.

original: g-yeng ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: g-yeng ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with distraction.

original: shes rab 'chal pa dang ldan @58b pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa dang ldan @58b pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with false wisdom.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with desire.

original: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with hatred.🔽He does not generate a mind that is associated with confusion.

original: gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with anger.

original: tha ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bcu gnyis pa yin no /
analyzed: tha ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bcu gnyis pa yin no /
translated: This is the twelfth aspect of development.

original: // / gzugs dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: // / gzugs dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with form.🔽He does not generate a mind that is associated with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: He does not generate a mind that is associated with the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening does not arise.🔽a mind endowed with the noble truths,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, emptiness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness, and the higher knowledges, meditative stabilizations, and dhāraṇī gateways does not arise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: a mind endowed with the powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha does not arise.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang ldan pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: a mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience does not arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe chos gang yang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe chos gang yang dmigs su med de /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because when great bodhisattva beings practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, they do not apprehend any phenomena at all.

original: ma dmigs pas chos gang la yang sems bskyed pa med do //
analyzed: ma dmigs pas chos gang la yang sems bskyed pa med do //
translated: Since they do not apprehend anything, they do not generate the mind that is set on enlightenment with respect to any phenomena.

original: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who train in this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom in that manner will master all the transcendent perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the transcendent perfections will be included.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang mthun par spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang mthun par spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will practice in harmony with all the transcendent perfections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus so zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bcu gsum pa yin @59a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus so zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bcu gsum pa yin @59a * //
translated: This is the thirteenth growth.

original: no; ; // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: no; ; // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: 'jig tshogs su lta bar lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po thams cad kyang 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta bar lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po thams cad kyang 'dus pa yin te /
translated: all the sixty-two views are included in the view of the transitory collection.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus so //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, in this profound perfection of wisdom all the perfections are included.”

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: skyes bu dus byas par gyur pa'i 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'gags pas dbang po thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu dus byas par gyur pa'i 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'gags pas dbang po thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: when a person’s life faculty ceases, all the faculties cease.”

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom include all the perfections.

original: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to go to the other side of all the perfections should train in this deep perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcu bzhi pa yin no /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa yin no /
translated: This is the fourteenth🔽increase.

original: // / rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: // / rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba la slob pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings training in this deep perfection of wisdom train to become the best of all beings.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag ci mang ba yin nam /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag ci mang ba yin nam /
translated: Are the sentient beings in the great billionfold world system numerous?

original: gsol pa ; bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: gsol pa ; bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, they are numerous.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: Well-Gone One, they are numerous.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams kyang mang ba lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams kyang mang ba lags na /
translated: Blessed One, the sentient beings in Jambudvīpa are numerous.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams lta smos kyang ca 'tshal /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams lta smos kyang ca 'tshal /
translated: What need is there to mention the sentient beings in the great billionfold world system?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te /
translated: “Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in the great billionfold world system were to obtain a human body at the same time,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la /
translated: and were to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad re re la yang sku tshe'i mthar phyin gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun ma chad par na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyan gyi rkyen sman dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad re re la yang sku tshe'i mthar phyin gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun ma chad par na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyan gyi rkyen sman dang /
translated: and if, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being were to serve all those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas, with all the necessities of life, with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and with medicines for sicknesses, and with many other useful things,

original: yo byad mang pos bsnyen bkur byas na /
analyzed: yo byad mang pos bsnyen bkur byas na /
translated: would that bodhisattva great being generate a lot of merit on that basis?”

original: rab 'byor de ji @59b snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji @59b snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti,” asked the Lord, “what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de'i rgyus bsod nams mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de'i rgyus bsod nams mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would that bodhisattva great being generate a lot of merit on that basis?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: “Lord, a lot,” he replied.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: “Well-gone one, a lot,” he replied.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Subhūti, a son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing /
translated: a daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this deep perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed na /
translated: If one were to make an effort in suchness,

original: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: his merit would increase even more.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de ltar don chen por 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de ltar don chen por 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings is like that, becoming a great benefit,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub pa'o //
translated: accomplishing unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi bla na med par 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi bla na med par 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to be unsurpassed for all beings, who want to be a protector for those without a protector, who want to be a refuge for those without a refuge,

original: dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / skyob med pa rnams kyi skyob par 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang ; gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / gling med pa rnams kyi gling du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / skyob med pa rnams kyi skyob par 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang ; gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / gling med pa rnams kyi gling du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: They wish to be a refuge for those who have no refuge, a protector for those who have no protector, a support for those who have no support, an island for those who have no island,

original: mun par gnas pa rnams kyi sgron mer 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar 'thob par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul khong du chud par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pas rnam par rtse bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: mun par gnas pa rnams kyi sgron mer 'gyur bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar 'thob par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul khong du chud par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pas rnam par rtse bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: a lamp for those who are in the dark, to attain buddhahood, to comprehend the domain of the buddhas, to play with the play of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi seng ge'i sgra'i nga ro bsgrags par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnga brdung par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi dung 'bud par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gtam bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi seng ge'i sgra'i nga ro bsgrags par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnga brdung par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi dung 'bud par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gtam bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Those who wish to roar the lion’s roar of the buddhas, who wish to beat the drum of the buddhas, who wish to blow the conch of the buddhas, who wish to give the teachings of the buddhas should train in this deep perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni phun sum tshogs pa gang thob par bya ba de dag las mi thob pa gang yang med @60a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni phun sum tshogs pa gang thob par bya ba de dag las mi thob pa gang yang med @60a * //
translated: “Subhūti, there is nothing that a bodhisattva great being training in this deep perfection of wisdom will not attain of the perfections to attain.🔽”

original: do ; / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: do ; / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bgyi ba lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bgyi ba lags sam /
translated: “Lord, will they also attain the perfection of śrāvakas?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bgyi ba lags sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bgyi ba lags sam /
translated: Will they also attain the perfection of pratyekabuddhas?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“They will attain them, but they will not take rebirth on the strength of those perfections.”

original: rab 'byor nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bya la /
analyzed: rab 'byor nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bya la /
translated: “Subhūti, they should also attain the perfection of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bya ba des /🔽de la gnas par mi bya /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bya ba des / de la gnas par mi bya /
translated: and the perfection of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽But they should not rest on them,

original: 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: 'dug par mi bya /
translated: they should not dwell on them,

original: shes pa dang mthong bas de dag bltas nas 'da' bar bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong bas de dag bltas nas 'da' bar bya ste /
translated: they should go beyond them by knowing and seeing them,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: and they should enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings training like that get close to the knowledge of all aspects

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten na sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten na sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings training like that become worthy of the offerings of the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ma yin pa'i sbyin pa'i gnas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad zil gyis mnan zhing 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ma yin pa'i sbyin pa'i gnas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad zil gyis mnan zhing 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who trains thus, surpasses all the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin te /🔽rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi gtong zhing shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin te / rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi gtong zhing shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: He comes near to the knowledge of all modes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who trains thus, does not desert the perfection of wisdom, he courses in the perfection of wisdom, he is not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can du rig par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom like that are people who do not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ring du byed cing /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ring du byed cing /
translated: They distance themselves from the śrāvaka level and the pratyekabuddha level,🔽and they approach unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bco lnga pa yin no /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bco lnga pa yin no /
translated: This is the fifteenth growth.

original: // / gal te yang 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: // / gal te yang 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: “If they think, ‘This is the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni @60b 'di na'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni @60b 'di na'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is here,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: with this perfection of wisdom the knowledge of all aspects is accomplished,’

original: gal te de ltar shes na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: if they know it like that, they do not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: “If it is the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di na yod do zhes bya bar shes pa med de /🔽gang gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas byung ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di na yod do zhes bya bar shes pa med de / gang gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas byung ste /
translated: it is not known as ‘the perfection of wisdom is here.’🔽It is not known as ‘this is the perfection of wisdom,’🔽nor is it known as ‘this is the one by whom the perfection of wisdom is practiced,’🔽nor is it known as ‘this is the one by whom the perfection of wisdom has arisen and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de lta bu yang mi shes mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de lta bu yang mi shes mi mthong zhing /
translated: has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de 'di snyam ste /
translated: “It occurs to him to think,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas pa'i phyir 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas pa'i phyir 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin /
translated: ‘Because the realm of phenomena, the true nature, and the very limit of reality remain, this is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di na yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di na yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not here.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis ni chos gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang med do zhes rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis ni chos gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang med do zhes rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who practices like this practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bcu drug pa yin te /
analyzed: ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bcu drug pa yin te /
translated: This is the sixteenth increase.

original: 'di dag ni rnam par 'phel ba bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par 'phel ba bstan pa yin no /
translated: These are the teachings on the increases.

original: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, thought, In this regard, a bodhisattva great being's perfection of generosity, perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom are not broken up.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang /
translated: inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature;

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa @61a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa @61a * //
translated: the noble truths, the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurable thoughts, the formless meditative stabilizations,

original: rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
analyzed: rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
translated: the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation,🔽the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽“If they surpass all beings while practicing them, what need is there to speak of when they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la yang spyod bzhin du sems can thams cad zil gyis gnon na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na lta ci smos /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la yang spyod bzhin du sems can thams cad zil gyis gnon na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na lta ci smos /
translated: They practice the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and they surpass all sentient beings. What need is there to mention when they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood?”🔽

original: sems can gang gi sems rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug pa de dag kyang thob pa legs par thob cing de dag gi 'tsho ba legs par 'tsho ba yin na /
analyzed: sems can gang gi sems rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug pa de dag kyang thob pa legs par thob cing de dag gi 'tsho ba legs par 'tsho ba yin na /
translated: Those sentient beings whose minds are engaged in the knowledge of all aspects have attained a good attainment and they live a good life.

original: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dag lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dag lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who have given rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: sems can gang gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: sems can gang gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: Those sentient beings who have given rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa de dag ni kun gyi yid du 'ong bar bya ba yin no snyam du sems par gyur to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa de dag ni kun gyi yid du 'ong bar bya ba yin no snyam du sems par gyur to //
translated: and who listen to this perfection of wisdom should be thought of as being dear to everyone.”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis me tog man da ra ba mang po blangs te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis me tog man da ra ba mang po blangs te /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, took many coral tree flowers

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas me tog man da ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas me tog man da ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor to //
translated: and went to the Lord. He scattered those coral tree flowers over the Tathāgata, the worthy one, the perfectly complete Buddha,

original: mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: mngon par gtor to //
translated: and offered them.

original: rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: rab tu gtor to //
translated: They scattered them well.

original: de ltar mngon par gtor rab tu gtor nas tshig 'di skad brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par gtor rab tu gtor nas tshig 'di skad brjod do //
translated: Having scattered them well, they said this:🔽“By this root of merit, may those persons who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle complete the qualities of a Buddha,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dmigs pa de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dmigs pa de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
translated: complete the qualities of omniscience,🔽complete the qualities of self-arising, and complete the qualities of the uncontaminated.”

original: nyid kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / rang byung gi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba ni kun mkhyen nyid gsum gyi chos @61b rnams bla na med pa
analyzed: nyid kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / rang byung gi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba ni kun mkhyen nyid gsum gyi chos @61b rnams bla na med pa
translated: This is the completion of the qualities of the three omnisciences,🔽the highest,🔽the complete,

original: yang dag par yongs su rdzogs pa yin no /
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su rdzogs pa yin no /
translated: and the perfect.

original: // / bcom ldan 'das bdag ni gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pas /🔽slar ldog par 'gyur pa sems 'ga' tsam yang skye ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: // / bcom ldan 'das bdag ni gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pas / slar ldog par 'gyur pa sems 'ga' tsam yang skye ba ma mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, I have not given rise to even a single thought of turning back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, from being a person who has entered the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar log ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar log ste /
translated: Blessed One, I have not given rise to even a single thought of turning back from being a bodhisattva great being,

original: nyan thos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos sam /
translated: from being a śrāvaka,

original: rang sang rgyas su 'gyur bar sems 'ga' tsam yang skye ba ma mchis kyi /
analyzed: rang sang rgyas su 'gyur bar sems 'ga' tsam yang skye ba ma mchis kyi /
translated: or from being a pratyekabuddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mos pa bskyed cing yang dang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal mang po 'di dag mthong nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mos pa bskyed cing yang dang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal mang po 'di dag mthong nas /
translated: I have given rise to the aspiration for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and again and again I have made prayers for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. Seeing these many sufferings of cyclic existence,

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi don du sman par mos /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi don du sman par mos /
translated: I aspire to be a doctor for the sake of the world with its gods, humans, and antigods.

original: bde bar mos zhing legs par bgyi bar mos te /
analyzed: bde bar mos zhing legs par bgyi bar mos te /
translated: He should imagine that he is happy and that he is doing well.

original: sems bskyed pa de lta bu dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar rtog ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de lta bu dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar rtog ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has such an attitude should think,

original: ci bdag brgal nas sems can ma brgal ba sgrol bar 'gyur ram /🔽ci bdag grol nas sems can ma grol ba 'grol bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci bdag brgal nas sems can ma brgal ba sgrol bar 'gyur ram / ci bdag grol nas sems can ma grol ba 'grol bar 'gyur ram /
translated: “Having crossed over, will I liberate beings who have not crossed over?🔽Having been freed, will I free beings who have not been freed?

original: bdag dbugs phyin nas sems can dbugs ma byung ba dbugs 'byin par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag dbugs phyin nas sems can dbugs ma byung ba dbugs 'byin par 'gyur /
translated: Having been comforted, will I comfort beings who are not comforted?🔽Having been totally emancipated, will I totally emancipate beings who have not been totally emancipated?”

original: ci bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas sems can yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar 'gyur ram zhes rtog ste zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba yin te /
analyzed: ci bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas sems can yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar 'gyur ram zhes rtog ste zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba yin te /
translated: This is the non-abandonment of the aims of beings.

original: nges par brten pa gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: nges par brten pa gsungs pa yin no /
translated: This is the teaching on the certainty of the basis.

original: // / bcom ldan 'das de ltar theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa dang / yun ring po nas spyod spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa dang /🔽phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de la @62a * //
analyzed: // / bcom ldan 'das de ltar theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa dang / yun ring po nas spyod spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de la @62a * //
translated: Blessed One, when those who are new to the vehicle rejoice in the arousing of the mind of awakening by the bodhisattva great beings, and when they rejoice in the arousing of the mind of awakening by the bodhisattva great beings who have been practicing for a long time,

original: rjes su yi rang bar bgyid na /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar bgyid na /
translated: and when they rejoice in the arousing of the mind of awakening by the bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible, and when they rejoice in the arousing of the mind of awakening by the bodhisattva great beings who are impeded by only one birth,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ji tsam zhig tu 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ji tsam zhig tu 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: how much will the merit of those sons of noble family or daughters of noble family increase?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had thus spoken, the Lord said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:🔽

original: koo shi ka gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni srang la gzhal ba'i tshad kyis tshad gzung bar rung yang srid kyi /
analyzed: koo shi ka gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni srang la gzhal ba'i tshad kyis tshad gzung bar rung yang srid kyi /
translated: The Blessed One replied to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, “Kauśika, it is possible that the world system of the four continents could be measured by weighing it with a scale,

original: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams la ni tshad med do //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams la ni tshad med do //
translated: but the merit of the rejoicing and associated generation of the mind of awakening is immeasurable.

original: koo shi ka stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang ; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni srang la gzhal ba'i tshad kyis tshad gzung bar rung yang srid kyi /
analyzed: koo shi ka stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang ; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni srang la gzhal ba'i tshad kyis tshad gzung bar rung yang srid kyi /
translated: Kauśika, it is possible that the world system of a thousand worlds, the world system of a double thousand worlds, and the world system of a great triple thousand worlds could be measured by weighing it with a scale,

original: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams la ni tshad med do //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams la ni tshad med do //
translated: but the merit of the rejoicing and associated generation of the mind of awakening is immeasurable.”

original: koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po rnams la chu'i phung po chen po ji snyed yod pa de dag ni skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshegs pa'i cha gcig gis chu'i thigs pa blangs pa'i tshad kyis tshad gzung bar
analyzed: koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po rnams la chu'i phung po chen po ji snyed yod pa de dag ni skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshegs pa'i cha gcig gis chu'i thigs pa blangs pa'i tshad kyis tshad gzung bar
translated: “Kauśika, it is possible to measure the great mass of water in the great oceans of the world systems in the great trichiliocosm with a tip of hair split a hundred times,

original: rung yang srid kyi /
analyzed: rung yang srid kyi /
translated: but

original: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams la ni tshad med do //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams la ni tshad med do //
translated: it is not possible to measure the merit of the rejoicing in the generation of the thought.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: ” When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar mi bgyid pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar mi bgyid pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: “Lord, those beings who do not rejoice in those thoughts have been favored by Māra.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das gang sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar mi bgyid pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi phyogs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar mi bgyid pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi phyogs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, those sentient beings who do not rejoice in these thoughts are on the side of Māra.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar mi bgyid pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar mi bgyid pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, those sentient beings who do not rejoice in these thoughts have died in the abode of Māra.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems bskyed pa 'di bsgrubs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems bskyed pa 'di bsgrubs te /
translated: Blessed One, those sentient beings who have accomplished these thoughts

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi gnas 'jig par bgyid pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi gnas 'jig par bgyid pa ste /
translated: and dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening destroy the abode of Māra.

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i @62b sems bskyed pa de dag ni rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa ste /
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i @62b sems bskyed pa de dag ni rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa ste /
translated: Those who have given rise to the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening rejoice in these thoughts.

original: gang gis sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba de dag gis sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba de dag gis sems bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
translated: Those who have not abandoned the Buddha, who have not abandoned the Dharma, and who have not abandoned the Saṅgha should rejoice in those thoughts of enlightenment.

original: rjes su yi rang bar bgyis nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar bgyis nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bgyi ste /
translated: Having rejoiced, they should dedicate [the merit] to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ji ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba dang / gnyis su ma mchis pa'i 'du shes su yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba dang / gnyis su ma mchis pa'i 'du shes su yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
translated: They should dedicate [the merit] in such a way that there is no notion of duality and also no notion of non-duality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: koo shi ka gang sems bskyed pa 'di dag la rjes su yi rang bar byas pa de dag ni myur du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang sems bskyed pa 'di dag la rjes su yi rang bar byas pa de dag ni myur du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, those who rejoice in these arousings of mind will quickly please the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Rightly Self-awakened Buddhas.

original: mnyes par byas nas kyang thugs byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyes par byas nas kyang thugs byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having pleased them, they will not displease them.

original: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang ldan pa dag ni gang du skyes pa de dang de dag tu rim gror bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang ldan pa dag ni gang du skyes pa de dang de dag tu rim gror bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with those wholesome roots connected with the arousing of mind that is accompanied by rejoicing, wherever they are reborn, there they will be honored,

original: bkur stir bya bar 'gyur ro //🔽bsti stang du bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bkur stir bya bar 'gyur ro // bsti stang du bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: worshipped, revered,

original: mchod pa bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod pa bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and venerated.

original: des nam yang gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nam yang gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never see an unpleasant form.

original: nam yang sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never hear an unpleasant sound.

original: nam yang dri yid du mi 'ong ba tshor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang dri yid du mi 'ong ba tshor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never smell an unpleasant smell.

original: nam yang reg yid du mi 'ong ba reg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang reg yid du mi 'ong ba reg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will never experience anything unpleasant to the touch.

original: nam yang chos yid du mi 'ong ba shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang chos yid du mi 'ong ba shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never know anything unpleasant.

original: nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will never be separated from the lord buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will go from buddhafield to buddhafield, serving and honoring the lord buddhas and planting wholesome roots.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa gzhal du med grangs med tshad med pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang @63a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa gzhal du med grangs med tshad med pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang @63a * //
translated: And why?

original: bar byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos so //
analyzed: bar byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos so //
translated: Kauśika, it is because those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family have rejoiced in the wholesome roots of incalculable, innumerable, immeasurable bodhisattva great beings who have newly set out in the vehicle, and have transferred them over to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sa dang po la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sa gnyis pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sa gsum pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sa bzhi pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: sa dang po la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sa gnyis pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sa gsum pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sa bzhi pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: the roots of virtue of those abiding on the first ground, the roots of virtue of those abiding on the second ground, the roots of virtue of those abiding on the third ground, the roots of virtue of those abiding on the fourth ground,

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis rnam par 'phel bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang🔽nye bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis rnam par 'phel bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the roots of virtue of those abiding on the tenth ground, and the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are impeded by a single birth, rejoicing in those roots of virtue and, through increasing those roots of virtue,🔽approaching unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: They are approaching unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can grangs med gzhal du med tshad med pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can grangs med gzhal du med tshad med pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they will lead countless, innumerable sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa.

original: koo shi ka de ltar rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang nas /
translated: “Kauśika, in this way, by this type of explanation, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family should rejoice in those wholesome roots of the bodhisattva great beings who have produced the first production of the thought,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: and should dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ji ltar sems gzhan la mi rgyu ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems gzhan la mi rgyu ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: They should dedicate them in such a way that the mind does not move to anything else.”

original: spyod pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: spyod pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: Having rejoiced in the roots of virtue of those who are irreversible and those who are impeded by one birth, one should dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ji ltar sems gzhan du mi rgyu ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems kun tu gnas pa'o /
analyzed: ji ltar sems gzhan du mi rgyu ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems kun tu gnas pa'o /
translated: “One should dedicate them in such a way that the mind does not go elsewhere.” This is the mind’s stability.

original: // / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: “Having rejoiced in the roots of virtue of those who are irreversible and those who are impeded by one birth, one should dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ji ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po 'jug pa'i phyogs la brten pa'o /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po 'jug pa'i phyogs la brten pa'o /
translated: “One should dedicate in such a way that one does not have the notion of two, nor the notion of non-duality.” This is the first conceptualization of the objective, based on the side of engagement.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe @63b dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe @63b dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, is only the perfection of wisdom non-conceptual,

original: 'on te bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin /
translated: or are the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity also non-conceptual?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:🔽“Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration is nonconceptual.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are nonconceptual.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci gzugs kyang rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci gzugs kyang rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin nam /
translated: ” “Venerable Subhūti, is form also nonconceptual?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness also nonconceptual?

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination also nonconceptual?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the perfections also nonconceptual?

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are all emptinesses nonconceptual?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the thirty-seven factors of awakening nonconceptual?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the noble truths, the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions nonconceptual?

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness nonconceptual?

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways nonconceptual?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang rnam par @64a * //🔽mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang rnam par @64a * // mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are nonconceptual?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience nonconceptual?

original: byang chub kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Is awakening nonconceptual?

original: sangs rgyas kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Is a buddha nonconceptual?

original: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam / rab 'byor gyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o /
translated: Are the compounded element and the uncompounded element nonconceptual?”🔽Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, all phenomena are nonconceptual.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te de ltar chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te de ltar chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Venerable Subhūti, if all phenomena are nonconceptual,

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi'i 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba zhes tha dad du dbye ba ci las 'ong /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi'i 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba zhes tha dad du dbye ba ci las 'ong /
translated: How could there be a different classification of the five destinies of the hells, the animal realm, the world of Yama, the gods, and humans?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su brjod pa'ang ci las gyur /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su brjod pa'ang ci las gyur /
translated: How could there be the designations of stream enterer, once-returner, nonreturner, arhat, pratyekabuddha, bodhisattva, and buddha bhagavān?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can gang phyin ci log las byung ba'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag 'di lta bu'i skye mched mngon par bsgrubs shing las kyi rnam par smin pa phung po'i gzhi can rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can gang phyin ci log las byung ba'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag 'di lta bu'i skye mched mngon par bsgrubs shing las kyi rnam par smin pa phung po'i gzhi can rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yongs su bzung ste /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, sentient beings who create physical, verbal, and mental actions that arise from error establish such sense sources and take up the ripening of karma that arises from the basis of the aggregates and conceptualization.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba mngon par sgrub po //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba mngon par sgrub po //
translated: He establishes the destinies of the hells, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang khyod kyis 'di skad du rgyun du zhugs par brjod pa ci las gyur /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang khyod kyis 'di skad du rgyun du zhugs par brjod pa ci las gyur /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, you asked, ‘What is the reason for calling it “stream enterer”?

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su brjod pa ci las gyur zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su brjod pa ci las gyur zhes zer ba ni /
translated: What is the reason for calling it “once-returner,” “non-returner,” “arhat,” “pratyekabuddha,” “bodhisattva,” and “tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha”?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs par brjod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs par brjod do //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is said to be a ‘stream enterer’ because of nonconceptuality.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
translated: It is said to be the ‘result of stream enterer’ because of nonconceptuality.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid du brjod do//
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid du brjod do//
translated: from non-conceptuality, the state of a once-returner, a non-returner, and an arhat are described.

original: @64b rnam par mi rtog pa las rang sangs rgyas dang / rang byang chub tu brjod do //
analyzed: @64b rnam par mi rtog pa las rang sangs rgyas dang / rang byang chub tu brjod do //
translated: from non-conceptuality, a pratyekabuddha and pratyekabuddha enlightenment are described.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas su brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas su brjod do //
translated: from non-conceptuality, a buddha is described.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las byang chub tu brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las byang chub tu brjod do //
translated: from non-conceptuality, enlightenment is described.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'das pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs🔽par gyur to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'das pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs par gyur to //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, all the buddha bhagavāns who have appeared in the past, as many as there are, those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, were without concepts and had abandoned concepts.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, in the future

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'gyur ro //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu da ltar byung ba'i dus na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'gyur ro // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu da ltar byung ba'i dus na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas, the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas who will appear in the future will also be free of conceptualization and will have abandoned conceptualization.

original: ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs pa sha stag go //
analyzed: ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs pa sha stag go //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, the Bhagavān buddhas who in the present are appearing in the world systems of the ten directions, who are attaining the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, those Bhagavān buddhas are also free of conceptualization and have abandoned conceptualization.

original: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i de bzhin dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid la brtson par byas te rnam par rtog pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i de bzhin dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid la brtson par byas te rnam par rtog pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for these reasons, you should understand that all phenomena are nonconceptual, in terms of suchness, the limit of reality, and the dharma-constituent.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste ;
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that, without conceptualization.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yin no /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu lnga pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yin no /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu lnga pa /
translated: Practicing the perfection of wisdom without conceptualization, they fully awaken to all dharmas without conceptualization.” This is the second conception of the apprehended, which is based on the side of reversal.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po la spyod pa'o //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa @65a * //
analyzed: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po la spyod pa'o // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa @65a * //
translated: “Ah! The bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom practice the essence.

original: sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: ” When this had been said, the venerable Subhūti said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po med pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po med pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: “Ah! The bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom practice the inessential.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom is inessential.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
