analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are insubstantial.

original: nang stong pa nyid ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: inner emptiness is insubstantial,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is insubstantial.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: the applications of mindfulness are insubstantial,

original: yang dag par spang ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spang ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path are insubstantial.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are insubstantial.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, is insubstantial.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
translated: Because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend and do not see even insubstantiality.

original: snying po dmigs pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: snying po dmigs pa lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they apprehend a core?

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu shin tu mang po dag 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu shin tu mang po dag 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: Then a very large number of gods from the desire realm and the form realm had this thought:

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa dang / don 'di la spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' gang mngon du byas pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa dang / don 'di la spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' gang mngon du byas pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who have produced the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and those who practice this profound perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, and who practice this meaning, but do not actualize the reality limit by actualizing the reality limit on which they would stand in the śrāvaka’s or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bgyi ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bgyi ba'i gnas te /
translated: pratyekabuddha’s state—those are the ones who are worthy of homage.

original: rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi mnyam pa nyid 'di mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi mnyam pa nyid 'di mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: “For that reason also, Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who do not actualize this sameness of dharmas are worthy of homage.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan @65b pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan @65b pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to those gods, “Gods, it is so!

original: lha'i bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la ni chos kyi mnyam pa nyid gang mngon du byas pas /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la ni chos kyi mnyam pa nyid gang mngon du byas pas / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “Divine princes, it is not difficult for bodhisattva great beings to actualize the sameness of phenomena,🔽and then to not actualize the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba de mngon du mi byed pa de ni mi dka'i /🔽lha'i bu dag sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes go cha bgos la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba de mngon du mi byed pa de ni mi dka'i / lha'i bu dag sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes go cha bgos la /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i sems can de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa de ni de dag la de bas dka' ste /
analyzed: gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i sems can de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa de ni de dag la de bas dka' ste /
translated: Divine princes, it is not difficult for those who have donned the armor to think, ‘I will lead all sentient beings—immeasurable, innumerable, limitless—to complete nirvāṇa,’🔽and then to not apprehend any sentient beings at all.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who practice in this way set out for unsurpassed and perfect awakening, thinking, ‘I will guide all sentient beings.’

original: gang sems can gdul bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' gdul bar sems pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gang sems can gdul bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' gdul bar sems pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: “Those who think to train sentient beings are like those who think to train space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir sems can dben par blta'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir sems can dben par blta'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are seen to be isolated due to the isolation of space.

original: nam mkha' stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can stong pa nyid du blta'o //🔽nam mkha' snying po med pa'i phyir sems can snying po med par blta'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can stong pa nyid du blta'o // nam mkha' snying po med pa'i phyir sems can snying po med par blta'o //
translated: Sentient beings are seen to be empty due to the emptiness of space.🔽Sentient beings are seen to be insubstantial due to the insubstantiality of space.

original: nam mkha' gsog gi phyir sems can gsog tu blta'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' gsog gi phyir sems can gsog tu blta'o //
translated: Sentient beings are seen to be worthless due to the worthlessness of space.

original: lha'i bu dag rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can med pa rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can med pa rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
translated: “Divine princes, for these reasons, the bodhisattva great beings who don the armor for the sake of those who are nonexistent are doing something difficult.

original: gang sems can rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni nam mkha' dang brtsad par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: gang sems can rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni nam mkha' dang brtsad par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Those who don the armor for the sake of sentient beings are like those who wish to argue with space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha de yang bgos la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha de yang bgos la /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings don that armor

original: sems can gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: And those beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great being dons the armor, those beings too are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sems can dben pa'i phyir go cha dben par blta'o //
analyzed: sems can dben pa'i phyir go cha dben par blta'o //
translated: Because of the seclusion of beings, the armor should be seen as secluded.

original: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhum par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhum par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If, when this is being taught, the bodhisattva great being does not lose heart,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: then the bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gzugs dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes @66a * //
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes @66a * //
translated: Because of the seclusion of form, beings are secluded.

original: pa dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: pa dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: Because of the seclusion of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, beings are secluded.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: Because of the seclusion of the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination, beings are secluded.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: “Sentient beings are isolated because the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening are isolated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: “Sentient beings are isolated because the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are isolated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: “Sentient beings are isolated because the knowledge of all aspects is isolated.

original: gzugs dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: “The perfection of wisdom is isolated because form is isolated.🔽“The perfection of wisdom is isolated because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are isolated.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: “The perfection of wisdom is isolated because the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are isolated.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because all perfections, all emptinesses, and all dharmas on the side of awakening are isolated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are isolated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience is isolated.

original: lha'i bu dag gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dben par bshad pa la sems mi zhum /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dben par bshad pa la sems mi zhum /
translated: “Divine princes, if the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not become cowed or timid when all phenomena are explained as isolated,

original: yongs su zhum par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yongs su zhum par mi 'gyur la /
translated: and if he does not turn back from them,

original: de'i yid 'jigs par mi 'gyur la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la brten pa'i rtogs pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: de'i yid 'jigs par mi 'gyur la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la brten pa'i rtogs pa dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first realization based on the substantial existence of a person.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: “Subhūti, why does a bodhisattva great being not become fainthearted about the perfection of wisdom?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He replied, “Lord, a bodhisattva great being does not become fainthearted about the perfection of wisdom because all phenomena do not exist.”

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad @66b dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma skyes pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad @66b dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma skyes pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings do not become disheartened with respect to the perfection of wisdom because all phenomena are void, peaceful, and unborn.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, for that reason bodhisattva great beings do not become disheartened with respect to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is because all those phenomena—that which would become disheartened, that by which it would become disheartened, and that with respect to which it would become disheartened—are non-existent.

original: dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: They are not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de skad du bshad pa la mi 'jum mi 'gong zhing yid ches pa dang / sgyid lug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de skad du bshad pa la mi 'jum mi 'gong zhing yid ches pa dang / sgyid lug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings do not become disheartened, do not become arrogant, and do not become discouraged when these teachings are explained,

original: mi 'jigs mi dngang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dngang /
translated: and if they are not frightened or terrified,

original: skrag par mi 'gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: skrag par mi 'gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags so //
translated: if he does not tremble, he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba'am ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba'am ;
translated: Because, Lord, all those dharmas which might become depressed,

original: gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or by which one might become depressed,

original: gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste /
translated: or in which one might become depressed, all those dharmas do not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dbang po dang bcas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dbang po dang bcas /
translated: Lord, the Bodhisattva, the great being who courses thus, is saluted by the gods with Indra,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas /🔽skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas / skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Brahma, and Prajapati.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni dbang po dang bcas /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni dbang po dang bcas /
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being who courses in the perfection of wisdom, is saluted by the gods with Indra,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas /
translated: Brahma, and Prajapati.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar yang ma zad de gang 'phags pa mngon par 'phags pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar yang ma zad de gang 'phags pa mngon par 'phags pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa /
translated: Not only will the gods, together with the Lord of the Gods, pay homage to him,

original: dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la phyag bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la phyag bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but also the gods of the Pure Abodes, such as the Gods of Limited Radiance, the Gods of Immeasurable Radiance, the Gods of Streaming Radiance, the Gods of Limited Virtue, the Gods of Immeasurable Virtue, and the Gods of Ubiquitous Virtue, will pay homage to the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: rab 'byor phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med tshad med pa gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @67a * //🔽chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag la dgongs par mdzad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med tshad med pa gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @67a * //🔽chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag la dgongs par mdzad de /
translated: Subhuti, the countless and limitless Tathagatas, Arhats, Samyak-sambuddhas who dwell, maintain themselves, and live in the worlds of the ten directions also think of those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: “This bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom perfects the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: He perfects the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: He perfects inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: He perfects the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions are perfected.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are perfected.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are perfected.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is perfected.”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar zhugs par
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar zhugs par
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom are the bodhisattva great beings to whom the lord buddhas pay attention.

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that they are set out for buddhahood.

original: rab 'byor gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad bdud sdig can du gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad bdud sdig can du gyur te /
translated: “Subhūti, all the beings there are in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, even if they were all to become Māra the wicked one,

original: bdud sdig can de dag re res kyang de snyed kyi bdud sdig can mngon par sprul kyang @67b de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bdud sdig can de dag re res kyang de snyed kyi bdud sdig can mngon par sprul kyang @67b de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: and each of those Māra the wicked ones were to conjure up that many Māra the wicked ones, none of them would be able to create an obstacle for those bodhisattva great beings.”

original: rab 'byor chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, the māras, the wicked ones, cannot overcome the bodhisattva great beings who have two dharmas.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: des chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par bltas pa yin /
analyzed: des chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par bltas pa yin /
translated: They are the ones who have looked at all dharmas as empty.

original: des sems can thams cad kyang yongs su ma btang ba yin te /
analyzed: des sems can thams cad kyang yongs su ma btang ba yin te /
translated: They are the ones who have not abandoned any sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor chos 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, the māras, the wicked ones, cannot overcome the bodhisattva great beings who have these two dharmas.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the māras, the wicked ones, cannot overcome the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who have two dharmas.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: ji skad du smras pa bzhin du byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa bzhin du byed pa yin /
translated: They are the ones who do as they say.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa yin te /
translated: They are the ones who are considered by the lord buddhas.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti, the Mara­ panna of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who is endowed with these two dharmas, cannot be overcome by the wicked Mara.

original: rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du ni lha'i bu rnams kyang nye bar 'ong bar sems so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du ni lha'i bu rnams kyang nye bar 'ong bar sems so //
translated: Subhuti, the Mara­ panna of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses thus, is not separated from the perfection of wisdom, and the gods will come to him,

original: bsnyen bkur ba dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / kun 'dri ba yang byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ba dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / kun 'dri ba yang byed par 'gyur te /
translated: will pay him homage, will ask him questions and hold discussion with him.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod sangs rgyas kyi byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur gyis /🔽de bas na rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod sangs rgyas kyi byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur gyis / de bas na rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: 'You, son of good family, will soon win full enlightenment.🔽Therefore, son of good family, you should course in this very perfection of wisdom, in this very perfection of giving, etc.

original: stong pa nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pas rnam par spyod pa dang / smon pa med pas rnam par spyod pa de nyid kyis rnam par spyod par gyis shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pas rnam par spyod pa dang / smon pa med pas rnam par spyod pa de nyid kyis rnam par spyod par gyis shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: to : perfection of meditation. And why?

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rnam par spyod pa des rnam par spyad pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du 'gyur ro //🔽sems can skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rnam par spyod pa des rnam par spyad pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du 'gyur ro // sems can skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, through this practice of yours, you will become a protector for sentient beings without a protector.🔽You will become a refuge for sentient beings without a refuge.

original: sems can skyob pa med pa rnams kyi skyob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can skyob pa med pa rnams kyi skyob par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a shelter for sentient beings without a shelter.

original: sems can dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ro //🔽sems can gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ro // sems can gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a friend for sentient beings without a friend.🔽You will become a home for sentient beings without a home.

original: sems can rten med pa rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ro //🔽sems can gling med pa rnams @68a * //
analyzed: sems can rten med pa rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ro // sems can gling med pa rnams @68a * //
translated: You will become a support for sentient beings without a support.

original: kyi gling du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi gling du 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become an island for sentient beings without an island.

original: sems can mun par gyur pa rnams kyi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes de la spro ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can mun par gyur pa rnams kyi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes de la spro ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a light for sentient beings in the dark.🔽And so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grang med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor te bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grang med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor te bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Because in the innumerable, countless world systems of the ten directions, as many buddha bhagavāns as there are, who are dwelling in and maintaining existence in them, surrounded by a saṅgha of monks, and teaching the Dharma, they too teach the Dharma by way of proclaiming the name and clan of that bodhisattva mahāsattva who is endowed with the qualities of the perfection of wisdom, saying, ‘That bodhisattva mahāsattva who is endowed with the qualities of the perfection of wisdom, namely,

original: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i ming dang rigs yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i ming dang rigs yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: those qualities of the perfection of wisdom, has been predicted to the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.’

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just as follows:

original: nga da ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen tog gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug phud kyi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos stong zhing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang /
analyzed: nga da ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen tog gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug phud kyi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos stong zhing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang /
translated: and I am teaching the Dharma by proclaiming the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Śikhī and uttering a cry of joy.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i zham 'bring na tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i zham 'bring na tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing
translated: I am teaching the Dharma by proclaiming the names of those who are practicing celibacy in the presence of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha Akṣobhya, who are not separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: and I am uttering a cry of joy.

original: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag la spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te ched
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag la spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te ched
translated: The lord buddhas in the eastern direction who are present, live happily, and teach the Dharma also, in the manner of one who is inspired, teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva great beings who are practicing celibacy and are not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: They also make proclamations.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
translated: The lord buddhas in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, and northwestern directions, below and above, who are present, live happily, and teach the Dharma also, in the manner of one who is inspired, teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva great beings who are practicing celibacy and are not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed @68b cig changs ba'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te ched
analyzed: chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed @68b cig changs ba'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te ched
translated: Those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma to those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who are practicing the Bodhisattva conduct and are not separated from the perfection of wisdom, by way of delighting them.

original: du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bar bzung ste /
analyzed: du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bar bzung ste /
translated: They also utter words of appreciation.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa
translated: Those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma to those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the time they attain omniscience, are training in the path to enlightenment, by way of delighting them. They also utter words of appreciation.

original: mdzad do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mdzad do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du zhugs pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du zhugs pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who have set out for the purpose of not interrupting the way of the buddhas are the ones who do what is difficult.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar ldog pa'am /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar ldog pa'am /
translated: ” Subhūti then inquired, “Lord, do those lord buddhas teach the Dharma by way of mentioning the names of those bodhisattva great beings who have turned back,

translated: or of those who have not turned back,🔽or of those who are irreversible?”🔽The Lord replied, “Subhūti, there are bodhisattva great beings who have turned back, and there are bodhisattva great beings who have not turned back,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang yod de /
translated: and there are bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible, practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro ba mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro ba mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston zhing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: The Buddha Bhagavāns teach the Dharma to them in a way that delights them and also utter words of appreciation.🔽Śāriputra said, “Bhagavān, who are they?”🔽The Bhagavān said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de dag gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de dag gang lags /
translated: “Śāriputra, the Buddha Bhagavāns teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, when practicing bodhisattva conduct,🔽are practicing in the manner of training in the way of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Akṣobhya, in a way that delights them and also utter words of appreciation.🔽“Śāriputra, the Buddha Bhagavāns teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, when practicing bodhisattva conduct,🔽are practicing in the manner of training in the way of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Ratnasaṃbhava, in a way that delights them and also utter words of appreciation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Śāriputra, the Buddha Bhagavāns teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, when practicing bodhisattva conduct,🔽are practicing in the manner of training in the way of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Amitābha, in a way that delights them and also utter words of appreciation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
