original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is a conceptualization of one’s own thought.

original: // / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni 'di ltar nga las nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: // / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni 'di ltar nga las nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni ring ngo /🔽bla na @74a * //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni ring ngo / bla na @74a * //
translated: a tathāgata emanation does not think, ‘The śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level is far from me.

original: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni nye'o zhes bgyi bar mi dgongs so //
analyzed: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni nye'o zhes bgyi bar mi dgongs so //
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is near.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is because the Tathāgata and the Tathāgata emanation are nonconceptual.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang 'di ltar bdag las nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang 'di ltar bdag las nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom does not think, ‘The śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level is far from me.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni ring ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni ring ngo //
translated: The level of a pratyekabuddha is far away.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni nye'o zhes bgyi bar mi sems so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni nye'o zhes bgyi bar mi sems so //
translated: Supreme and perfect awakening is near.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: Blessed One, it is because the perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual.

original: // / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa zhig sprul pa mdzad na de ni don gang gi slad du sprul pa'i don de sbyor te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa zhig sprul pa mdzad na de ni don gang gi slad du sprul pa'i don de sbyor te /
translated: if a tathāgata emanates an emanation, it will perform the function for which it was emanated.

original: sprul pa ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: sprul pa ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: But the emanation is nonconceptual and non-apprehending.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don gang gi slad du brjod pa'i don de yang bgyid la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rnam
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don gang gi slad du brjod pa'i don de yang bgyid la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rnam
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom performs the function for which it is taught, but the perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual and non-apprehending.

original: par rtog pa yin no /🔽// / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na shing mkhan nam /
analyzed: par rtog pa yin no / // / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na shing mkhan nam /
translated: It is a conceptualization.

original: shing mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis bud med kyi gzugs sam /
analyzed: shing mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis bud med kyi gzugs sam /
translated: Blessed One, for example, a carpenter or a carpenter’s skilled apprentice might construct a mechanical doll in the form of a woman,

original: skyes pa'i gzugs sam /🔽glang po'i gzugs sam /🔽chibs rta'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: skyes pa'i gzugs sam / glang po'i gzugs sam / chibs rta'i gzugs sam /
translated: in the form of a man,🔽in the form of an elephant,🔽in the form of a horse,

original: glang gi gzugs kyi 'khrul 'khor zhig sbyar na /
analyzed: glang gi gzugs kyi 'khrul 'khor zhig sbyar na /
translated: in the form of an ox,🔽and for whatever purpose the doll is made, that purpose is accomplished, but the doll does not have discursive thought.

original: do don gang gi slad du bgyis pa'i don de bsgrubs kyang 'khrul 'khor de ni rnam par mi rtog go / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don gang gi slad du brjod pa'i don de bgyid kyang shes rab kyi
analyzed: do don gang gi slad du bgyis pa'i don de bsgrubs kyang 'khrul 'khor de ni rnam par mi rtog go / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don gang gi slad du brjod pa'i don de bgyid kyang shes rab kyi
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom accomplishes whatever purpose it is taught for, but the perfection of wisdom does not have discursive thought.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: This is the conceptualization of action together with its result.

original: 'di dag gis ni 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gzung ba'i rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gzung ba'i rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
translated: These explain the first nine aspects of the conceptualization of apprehended objects that are based on the side of engagement.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de yun ring por ji @74b srid cig nas yang dag par zhugs pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de yun ring por ji @74b srid cig nas yang dag par zhugs pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Lord, how long has that bodhisattva great being who has such skillful means set out in the vehicle?”

original: rab 'byor thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pa nas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pa nas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, that bodhisattva great being who has such skillful means has set out in the vehicle for countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of eons.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des sangs rgyas ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur ba lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des sangs rgyas ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur ba lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, how many buddhas has that bodhisattva great being who has such skillful means served?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, that bodhisattva great being who has such skillful means has served as many buddhas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.”

original: rab 'byor thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that a bodhisattva great being who has such skillful means has served buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des dge ba'i rtsa ba ci zhig bskyed pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des dge ba'i rtsa ba ci zhig bskyed pa lags /
translated: Śāriputra asked, “Blessed One, what roots of virtue have bodhisattva great beings who have such skillful means planted?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
translated: there is no act related to the perfection of generosity that bodhisattva great beings who have skillful means do not complete.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang /
translated: There is no deed of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
translated: the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom that is not completed by that bodhisattva great being.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, those bodhisattva great beings who have such skillful means are amazing.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who have such skillful means are amazing.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing gling bzhi'i rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing gling bzhi'i rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: The orb of the sun and the orb of the moon perform their functions in the four continents and follow the four continents.

original: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They follow the four continents.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i @75a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i @75a * //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom performs the functions of the five perfections

original: las byed cing pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: las byed cing pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: and follows the five perfections and accompanies them.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na pha rol tu phyin pa lngas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob po //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na pha rol tu phyin pa lngas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob po //
translated: If it is not separated from the perfection of wisdom, the five perfections obtain the name of perfections.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa lngas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa lngas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo//
translated: If it is separated from the perfection of wisdom, the five perfections do not obtain the name of perfections.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as, for example,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang bral na 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi 'thob po //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang bral na 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi 'thob po //
translated: if a universal monarch is separated from the seven precious substances, he does not obtain the name of universal monarch.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dman pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dman pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the five perfections, without the perfection of wisdom, do not get the name of perfections.🔽

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the five perfections, without the perfection of wisdom, do not get the name of perfections.

original: khyim thab med pa'i bud med rnams ni 'phyon ma ba rnams kyis tshugs bar sla ba yin no //
analyzed: khyim thab med pa'i bud med rnams ni 'phyon ma ba rnams kyis tshugs bar sla ba yin no //
translated: Subhuti: It is just as if a woman, who has no husband, is easily approached by all men.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /🔽bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par sla ba yin no //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na / bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par sla ba yin no // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the five perfections, without the perfection of wisdom, are easily approached by the deeds of Mara and by the gods who side with Mara.

original: khyim thab dpa' bos shin tu bsrungs pa'i bud med shin tu phun sum tshogs pa'i khyim na 'dug pa ni 'phyon ma pa rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim thab dpa' bos shin tu bsrungs pa'i bud med shin tu phun sum tshogs pa'i khyim na 'dug pa ni 'phyon ma pa rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti: It is just as if a woman, who has a husband, who is a hero, who is a good protector, who is a good defender, who is powerful, who is mighty, who is not easily defeated, who is of good family, who is handsome, who is rich, who is wealthy, who is of great property, who is not poor, who is generous, who is not niggardly, who is not easily overcome by others, who is not despised by anyone, who is not despised by her husband, who is not despised by her kinsmen, who is not despised by her relatives, who is not despised by her friends, who is not despised by her companions, who is not despised by her neighbors, who is not despised by her relatives, who is not despised by her kinsmen, who is not despised by her husband, who is not despised by the people, who is not despised by the king, who is not despised by the king's ministers, who is not despised by the king's sons, who is not despised by the king's servants, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers, who is not despised by the king's doorkeepers

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam par rtog🔽pa yin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of non-apprehending.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: g-yul ngor 'gro ba'i skyes bu go cha tshang bar gyon pa mtshon cha thams cad thogs pa ni g-yul ngo na 'dug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: g-yul ngor 'gro ba'i skyes bu go cha tshang bar gyon pa mtshon cha thams cad thogs pa ni g-yul ngo na 'dug pa'i tshe /
translated: A man going to war, fully armored, carrying all weapons, when he is in battle,

original: rgyal po 'gran zla'am phyir rgol ba dang dgra rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
analyzed: rgyal po 'gran zla'am phyir rgol ba dang dgra rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
translated: is hard to overcome by kings, rivals, opponents, and enemies.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / gang zag lhag pa'i nga rgyal can nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / gang zag lhag pa'i nga rgyal can nam /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the five perfections are not overpowered by Māra or the devas of his class if they are not separated from the perfection of wisdom, nor by the conceited persons,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gdol pa rnams kyis kyang thub par dka'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i lam tshang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gdol pa rnams kyis kyang thub par dka'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i lam tshang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of the complete path of practice.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: mkhar gyi rgyal po rnams ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rjes su mthun par sgrub cing nang dang nub bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir 'ong bar byed @75b do ;
analyzed: mkhar gyi rgyal po rnams ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rjes su mthun par sgrub cing nang dang nub bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir 'ong bar byed @75b do ;
translated: the kings of the border regions come to the universal monarch, and in the morning and evening they come to serve and honor him.🔽Subhūti, in the same way, when the five perfections are embraced by the perfection of wisdom, they go to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ; rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog🔽pa yin no /
analyzed: ; rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of going by the condition of another.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: chu klung phra mo gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad ni chu klung chen po gang+g'a gang na ba der dong ste /
analyzed: chu klung phra mo gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad ni chu klung chen po gang+g'a gang na ba der dong ste /
translated: all the small rivers there are go to the great river Ganges, and

original: de dag chu klung gang+g'a dang 'grogs shing rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag chu klung gang+g'a dang 'grogs shing rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du 'dong ngo //
translated: They flow together with the Ganges River and enter the great ocean.🔽In the same way, Subhūti, the five perfections, when held by the perfection of wisdom, go to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der dong ngo zhes bya ba ni ched du bya ba las lhag pa'i rnam par rtog🔽pa yin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der dong ngo zhes bya ba ni ched du bya ba las lhag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of superiority over the aim.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: skyes bu'i lag pa g-yas pa ni dgos pa thams cad byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i lag pa g-yas pa ni dgos pa thams cad byed do //
translated: A person’s right hand does all the work.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin du blta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin du blta ste /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be seen in the same way.🔽The five perfections should be seen in the same way as the left hand.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni lag pa g-yon pa ji lta ba de bzhin du blta'o zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba'i byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni lag pa g-yon pa ji lta ba de bzhin du blta'o zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba'i byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of limited activity.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: chu klung phra mo rnams kyi chu dang / chu klung chen po rnams kyi chu gang ji snyad cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rgya mtsho chen por phyin na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chu klung phra mo rnams kyi chu dang / chu klung chen po rnams kyi chu gang ji snyad cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rgya mtsho chen por phyin na 'di lta ste /
translated: Whatever water there is in the small streams and the great rivers, all that water, when it reaches the great ocean, is of one taste, that is to say,

original: lan tshva ror ro gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan tshva ror ro gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is of the taste of salt.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin pa'i tshe 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin pa'i tshe 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when the five perfections, held by the perfection of wisdom, reach the knowledge of all aspects, they are of one taste, that is to say,🔽they are of the taste of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ror ro gcig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtog pa tha dad pa nyid kyi rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ror ro gcig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtog pa tha dad pa nyid kyi rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of the sameness of conceptions.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as, for example,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du ni 'khor lo rin po che 'gro zhing 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du ni 'khor lo rin po che 'gro zhing 'dug ste /
translated: the precious wheel goes in front of the king who is a wheel-turning emperor and his four-part army, and it stops where he stops.

original: gang du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po zas kyi don du 'dug par 'gyur ba 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad yongs su tshim par byed cing 'khor lo rin po che gnas nas g-yo ba med do //
analyzed: gang du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po zas kyi don du 'dug par 'gyur ba 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad yongs su tshim par byed cing 'khor lo rin po che gnas nas g-yo ba med do //
translated: Wherever the universal monarch sits for the sake of food, the entire army of the universal monarch is satisfied, and the precious wheel moves without leaving its place.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bkri ba yin te /🔽rnam pa thams cad @76a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bkri ba yin te / rnam pa thams cad @76a * //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, these five perfections are led by the perfection of wisdom.

original: mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong zhing der gnas so //
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong zhing der gnas so //
translated: They go to the knowledge of all aspects, and they stay there.🔽Having stayed there, they do not pass beyond that place.

original: der gnas par gyur nas kyang gnas de las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang 'jug pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: der gnas par gyur nas kyang gnas de las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang 'jug pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception that does not know staying and entering.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as follows:

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che de dang / blon po rin po che de dang / khyim bdag rin po che de dang / bud med rin po che de dang / nor bu rin po che de dang / glang po rin po che de dang /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che de dang / blon po rin po che de dang / khyim bdag rin po che de dang / bud med rin po che de dang / nor bu rin po che de dang / glang po rin po che de dang /
translated: The precious wheel of the universal monarch, the precious minister, the precious wife, the precious jewel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious steward, and the precious military commander.

original: rta rin po che de dag ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: rta rin po che de dag ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dong ngo //
translated: The precious wheel of the universal monarch, the precious jewel, the precious queen, the precious householder, the precious military commander, the precious elephant, the precious horse, and the precious steward—these seven precious things are in front of the four divisions of the army.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bo 'di dag gi mdun du 'gro ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bo 'di dag gi mdun du 'gro ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom goes in front of these five perfections,

original: mdun du song nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdun du song nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: and having gone in front, it stands where the knowledge of all aspects is.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not think, ‘The perfection of giving follows after me.’

original: 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: He does not think, ‘The perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, and perfection of concentration follow after me.’

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The perfection of giving does not think, ‘I follow after the perfection of wisdom.’

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, and perfection of concentration do not think, ‘I follow after the perfection of wisdom.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ni de yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ni de yin te /
translated: it is because that is their nature.

original: ci yang nus pa med pa /
analyzed: ci yang nus pa med pa /
translated: They are not able to do anything at all.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing gsog ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing gsog ste /
translated: They are empty of inherent nature and are worthless.

original: smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a mirage.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of inherent nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu @76b phyin pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu @76b phyin pa dang /
translated: Lord, how will bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving give gifts to those who are in need of the perfection of giving,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in the six perfections, should thus consider: 'Alas, this world has fallen into error,

original: de dag ni thabs la mi mkhas pas 'khor ba nas yongs su gdon par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni thabs la mi mkhas pas 'khor ba nas yongs su gdon par mi nus kyi /
translated: and cannot be delivered from Samsara without skill in means.

original: ma la bdag gis sems can de dag gi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag gis sems can de dag gi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Well would it be if I, for the sake of those beings, should course in the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in the perfection of morality,🔽in the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in the perfection of vigour,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas de sems can de dag gi don du phyi nang gi dngos po rnams yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: de nas de sems can de dag gi don du phyi nang gi dngos po rnams yongs su gtong ste /
translated: Then, for the sake of those beings, he gives away all his outer and inner things.

original: de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
translated: And when he gives them away, he thinks:

original: bdag gis gang yang yongs su btang ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gis gang yang yongs su btang ba med do //
translated: “I have not given anything away at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar dngos po de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo snyam mo //
translated: Because those things are empty of their own intrinsic nature.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have understood it like that complete the perfection of giving.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du tshul khrims ngan pa'i skabs mi 'byed do //
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du tshul khrims ngan pa'i skabs mi 'byed do //
translated: For the sake of those very beings, they do not give an opportunity to immorality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Because they think like this:

original: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs la /
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs la /
translated: “I have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun gyi tshig smra ba dang / phra ma can du 'gyur ba dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig smra ba dang / tshig 'khyal pa can du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun gyi tshig smra ba dang / phra ma can du 'gyur ba dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig smra ba dang / tshig 'khyal pa can du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: “They are: killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk,

original: brnab sems can du 'gyur ba dang / gnod sems su byed pa dang / log par lta ba can du 'gyur ba dang / yul la smon pa dang / lha dang / tshangs pa dang / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar smon pa 'di dag ni bdag la tshul khrims dang mi 'dra'o snyam ste /
analyzed: brnab sems can du 'gyur ba dang / gnod sems su byed pa dang / log par lta ba can du 'gyur ba dang / yul la smon pa dang / lha dang / tshangs pa dang / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar smon pa 'di dag ni bdag la tshul khrims dang mi 'dra'o snyam ste /
translated: covetousness, malice, wrong views, wishing for objects, and wishing for the state of a god, Brahmā, a śrāvaka, or a pratyekabuddha.

original: @77a * // rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: @77a * // rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who investigate in this way practice the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline.”

original: de sems can de nyid kyi don du tshig rtsub mo dang / brlang bas rtag tu spyos shing brgyad kyang 'khrugs pa'i sems mi bskyed /🔽rdo dbyug dang / bong ba dang / mtshon gyis btab cing bsnun pa dang / lus kyi yan lag gshags sam /
analyzed: de sems can de nyid kyi don du tshig rtsub mo dang / brlang bas rtag tu spyos shing brgyad kyang 'khrugs pa'i sems mi bskyed / rdo dbyug dang / bong ba dang / mtshon gyis btab cing bsnun pa dang / lus kyi yan lag gshags sam /
translated: For the sake of those very sentient beings, he does not become angry even if they constantly scold and revile him with rude and harsh words.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag bcad kyang zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag bcad kyang zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed do //
translated: Even if they strike him with clods of earth, sticks, or swords, or cut and mangle his limbs, he does not arouse a hostile mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni sgra thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sgra thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur yongs su rtog go //
translated: Because he fully understands that all sounds are like echoes.

original: gzugs thams cad dbu ba lta bur yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad dbu ba lta bur yongs su rtog go //
translated: He fully understands that all forms are like foam.

original: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who fully understands in this way practices the perfection of patience.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i phyir le lo'i sems mi bskyed de /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i phyir le lo'i sems mi bskyed de /
translated: For the sake of those very sentient beings, he does not arouse a lazy mind in order to seek all wholesome states.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: mtho ris su skye ba'ang le lo can gyis rnyed par dka' na /
analyzed: mtho ris su skye ba'ang le lo can gyis rnyed par dka' na /
translated: “Even birth in the heavens is difficult for the lazy to obtain,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyis de bas na bdag gis nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyis de bas na bdag gis nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
translated: let alone unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. Therefore, until I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will practice diligence.

original: rtag tu brtson pa mi 'dor bar bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: rtag tu brtson pa mi 'dor bar bya'o snyam ste /
translated: I will never give up constant diligence.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have such understanding practice the perfection of perseverance.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du sems mi g-yeng ba yin te /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du sems mi g-yeng ba yin te /
translated: For the sake of those very beings, their minds are not distracted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think as follows:

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan du skye ba'ang sems 'khrugs pas rnyed par dka' na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan du skye ba'ang sems 'khrugs pas rnyed par dka' na /
translated: “Even birth in the worldly concentrations is difficult for a disturbed mind to obtain,🔽let alone

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyis /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyis /
translated: how much more so for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening!

original: de bas na bdag gis nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du bdag gis sems mi 'khrugs par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du bdag gis sems mi 'khrugs par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: Therefore, until I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will not disturb my mind.’

original: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub @77b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub @77b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who fully knows in that way practices the perfection of concentration.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang shes rab dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang shes rab dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: For the sake of those very beings, until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they are never separated from wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is because they think like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma zhugs par rnam pa gzhan gyis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mi nus kyis /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma zhugs par rnam pa gzhan gyis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mi nus kyis /
translated: Without entering into the perfection of wisdom, it is not possible to bring about the maturation of sentient beings by any other means.

original: de bas na bdag gis shes rab 'chal ba dang ldan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam bskyed par mi bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis shes rab 'chal ba dang ldan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam bskyed par mi bya'o snyam ste /
translated: Therefore, I should not give rise to even a single thought that is associated with bad wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar yongs su rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have such thorough understanding practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te pha rol tu phyin pa la rnams la tha dad pa ma mchis na ;
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te pha rol tu phyin pa la rnams la tha dad pa ma mchis na ;
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, if the perfections are not separate from each other,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rab ces bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rab ces bgyi /
translated: why is this perfection of wisdom called the ‘perfection of the five perfections’?

original: gtso bo zhes bgyi /🔽mchog ces bgyi /🔽dam pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bgyi / mchog ces bgyi / dam pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the ‘chief’?🔽Why is it called the ‘best’?🔽Why is it called the ‘excellent’?🔽Why is it called the ‘supreme’?

original: phul zhes bgyi /🔽gya nom pa zhes bgyi /🔽bla na med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: phul zhes bgyi / gya nom pa zhes bgyi / bla na med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the ‘sublime’?🔽Why is it called the ‘unsurpassed’?

original: gong na med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the ‘highest’?

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi ;
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi ;
translated: “Incomparable”?

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi /
translated: “Equal to the unequalled”?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ni rnam pa tha dad pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ni rnam pa tha dad pa gang yang med de /
translated: Subhūti, the perfections are not differentiated in any way.

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom did not exist, these five perfections would not obtain the name of perfections.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is in dependence on the perfection of wisdom that these five perfections obtain the name of perfections.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as, for example,

original: lus rnam pa tha dad pa rnams ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi drung du phyin na kha dog gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus rnam pa tha dad pa rnams ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi drung du phyin na kha dog gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: when different bodies come into the presence of Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, they become of one color.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, it is on the basis of the perfection of wisdom that these five perfections get the name of perfections.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin /
translated: They also go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa @78a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa @78a * //
translated: In this way,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu kha dog gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu kha dog gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: they become of one color in the color of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of giving.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of morality.🔽This is the perfection of patience.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of perseverance.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of concentration.🔽This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes khyad par gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes khyad par gang yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir khyad par med do //
translated: Because they have no intrinsic nature, therefore there is no difference.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te don gyi rjes su zhugs pa la bye brag gam tha dad du bgyi ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te don gyi rjes su zhugs pa la bye brag gam tha dad du bgyi ba ma mchis na /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One, if there is no distinction or difference to be made in terms of the attainment of the meaning,🔽why is the perfection of wisdom said to be the best of those five perfections?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po de dag gi rab ces bgyi /🔽gtso bo zhes bgyi /🔽mchog ces bgyi /🔽dam pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po de dag gi rab ces bgyi / gtso bo zhes bgyi / mchog ces bgyi / dam pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it said to be the foremost?🔽Why is it said to be supreme?

original: phul zhes bgyi /🔽gya nom pa zhes bgyi /🔽bla na med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: phul zhes bgyi / gya nom pa zhes bgyi / bla na med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it said to be excellent?🔽Why is it said to be preeminent?🔽Why is it said to be sublime?

original: gong na med pa zhes bgyi /🔽mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bgyi / mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it said to be unsurpassed?🔽Why is it said to be unequaled?

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it said to be equal to the unequaled?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One replied, “🔽Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: don rjes su thob par bya ba la chos gang la yang bye brag dang khyad par med de /
analyzed: don rjes su thob par bya ba la chos gang la yang bye brag dang khyad par med de /
translated: There is no distinction or difference to be made in terms of the attainment of the meaning.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang / brdar nye bar bzung nas ;
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang / brdar nye bar bzung nas ;
translated: However, having taken up the conventions and expressions of the world,

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su gdon pa'i don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su gdon pa'i don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang yod do //
translated: For the sake of completely liberating sentient beings from cyclic existence, there is the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can de dag la yang skye ba med /
analyzed: sems can de dag la yang skye ba med /
translated: Those sentient beings are not born,

original: 'chi ba med /🔽'pho ba med /
analyzed: 'chi ba med / 'pho ba med /
translated: do not die,🔽do not transmigrate,

original: 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba med do //
translated: and do not arise.

original: sems can med pas chos thams cad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pas chos thams cad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since there are no sentient beings, all phenomena should be known to be nonexistent.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi rab ces bya /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi rab ces bya /
translated: Subhūti, from this one of many explanations this perfection of wisdom is the foremost of these five perfections,

original: gtso bo zhes bya /🔽mchog ces bya /🔽dam pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya / mchog ces bya / dam pa zhes bya /
translated: it is the chief,🔽it is the best,🔽it is the most excellent,

original: phul zhes bya /🔽gya nom pa zhes bya /🔽bla na med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: phul zhes bya / gya nom pa zhes bya / bla na med pa zhes bya /
translated: it is the most sublime,🔽it is the unequalled,🔽it is the unequaled,

original: gong na med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bya /
translated: it is the unsurpassed,🔽and it is the highest.

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: @78b 'dzam bu'i gling gi bud med gang ji snyed pa de dag gi nang du bud med rin po che ni rab ces bya /
analyzed: @78b 'dzam bu'i gling gi bud med gang ji snyed pa de dag gi nang du bud med rin po che ni rab ces bya /
translated: Among all the women in Jambudvīpa, the precious woman is called the best,

original: gtso bo zhes bya /🔽mchog ces bya /🔽dam pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya / mchog ces bya / dam pa zhes bya /
translated: the foremost,🔽the supreme,🔽the excellent,

original: phul zhes bya /
analyzed: phul zhes bya /
translated: the sublime,

original: gya nom pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya /
translated: the wondrous,

original: bla na med pa zhes bya /🔽gong na med pa zhes bya /🔽mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya / gong na med pa zhes bya / mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: the unsurpassed,🔽the unequaled,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: and the equal of the unequaled.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab ces bgyi ba dang / gtso bo zhes bgyi ba dang / mchog ces bgyi ba dang / dam pa zhes bgyi ba dang / phul zhes bgyi ba dang / gya nom pa zhes bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab ces bgyi ba dang / gtso bo zhes bgyi ba dang / mchog ces bgyi ba dang / dam pa zhes bgyi ba dang / phul zhes bgyi ba dang / gya nom pa zhes bgyi ba dang /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, thus the perfection of wisdom is called the best, the foremost, the supreme, the excellent, the sublime, the wondrous,

original: bla na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / gong na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi ba de ci las dgongs /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / gong na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi ba de ci las dgongs /
translated: “What is meant by ‘unsurpassed,’ ‘supreme,’ ‘unequalled,’ and ‘equal to the unequaled’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bzung zhing mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bzung zhing mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni
translated: “Subhūti, it is because this perfection of wisdom, having taken up all wholesome dharmas, will remain wherever the knowledge of all aspects is, in a manner of not remaining.

original: rjes la 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes la 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: This is the subsequent conceptual thought.

original: 'di dag gis ni bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
translated: These explain the second conceptual thought of grasping, which has nine aspects.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: He said,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong ba mchis sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong ba mchis sam /
translated: “Blessed One, does the perfection of wisdom take up or give up any dharma?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin te /
translated: Subhuti, that is not so.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong pa med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong pa med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not take hold of or let go of any dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad yongs su bzung ba med pa dang / btang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad yongs su bzung ba med pa dang / btang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhuti, it is because all dharmas are not taken hold of and not let go of.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad mi 'dzin mi gtong ba lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad mi 'dzin mi gtong ba lags /
translated: Subhuti said: Lord, how is the perfection of wisdom not the taking hold of or letting go of all dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom does not take hold of or let go of form.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom does not take hold of or let go of feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol @79a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol @79a * //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom does not take hold of or let go of the eye sense sphere.

original: tu phyin pa ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: tu phyin pa ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not grasp or reject the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo // rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not grasp or reject all the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven aspects of awakening.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not grasp or reject the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the eight perfect freedoms,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo zhes rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo zhes bya
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo zhes rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo zhes bya
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not hold or let go of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: ba ni 'dzin pa dang gtong ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: ba ni 'dzin pa dang gtong ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the concept of holding and letting go.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
translated: “Lord, how is form not held and not let go of?

original: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
translated: How is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness not held and not let go of?”

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
translated: How is it that the knowledge of all aspects is not grasped and not rejected?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor gzugs yid la mi byed pas gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs yid la mi byed pas gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi byed pas /
translated: Subhūti, form is not grasped and not rejected because it is not mentally constructed.

original: rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are not grasped and not rejected because they are not mentally constructed.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yid la mi byed pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yid la mi byed pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: The constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are not grasped and not rejected because they are not mentally constructed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid @79b thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi byed pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid @79b thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi byed pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: He does not pay attention to any of the perfections, any of the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, so he does not take up or give up the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang ; rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang ; rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He does not pay attention to the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi byed pas gzungs kyi sgo yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi byed pas gzungs kyi sgo yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: or wishlessness, so he does not take up or give up the emptiness, signlessness, or wishlessness doors of concentration and retention.🔽He does not pay attention to the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, so he does not take up or give up the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yid la mi byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yid la mi byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: because he does not pay attention to the ten powers of a Tathagata, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, or the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha, he does not take up or reject the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha.🔽because he does not pay attention to the knowledge of all modes, he does not take up or reject the knowledge of all modes.🔽Subhuti: So it is, Kausika, as you say.🔽Subhuti: So it is, Kausika, as you say.🔽Subhuti: So it is, Kausika, as you say.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi byed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi bgyi / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /

translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yid la @80a * //
translated: They should not pay attention to the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

analyzed: mi bgyi / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi bgyi na /
translated: up to and should not pay attention to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das gzugs yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das gzugs yid la ma bgyis /
translated: “Lord, if bodhisattvas do not pay attention to form,

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yid la ma bgyis /
translated: do not pay attention to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,
