original: @86b bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni gang lags /
analyzed: @86b bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni gang lags /
translated: Bhagavan, what is the path of bodhisattva mahāsattvas?

original: lam ma lags pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: lam ma lags pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is not the path?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bar bya ba la nyan thos kyi lam ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bar bya ba la nyan thos kyi lam ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no //
translated: The śrāvaka path is not the path of bodhisattva mahāsattvas for attaining the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no //
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddhas is not the path of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ste /
translated: The six perfections with the perfection of wisdom at the forefront are the path of the bodhisattva great beings for attaining the knowledge of all aspects.🔽That is the bodhisattva’s path and not the path.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang lam ma yin po'o zhes bya ba ni lam dang lam ma yin pa'i nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang lam ma yin po'o zhes bya ba ni lam dang lam ma yin pa'i nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of the ascertainment of the path and not the path.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lam dang lam ma lags pa ston pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lam dang lam ma lags pa ston pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
translated: “Lord, this perfection of wisdom, which teaches the path and not the path, is present for the benefit of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam dang lam ma yin pa ston pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas so //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don tshad med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam dang lam ma yin pa ston pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas so // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don tshad med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present for the great purpose of the bodhisattva great beings, because it teaches the path and what is not the path.🔽The perfection of wisdom is present for the bodhisattva great beings for the sake of immeasurable purpose.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don grangs med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don grangs med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present for the bodhisattva great beings for the sake of innumerable purpose.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni don de yang brjod mod kyi gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni don de yang brjod mod kyi gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does indeed express that purpose, but does not grasp form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: It does not grasp feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ni 'gyur ba'i bar du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ni 'gyur ba'i bar du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not stand in the way of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'thob par byed pa ma yin no /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'thob par byed pa ma yin no /
translated: This perfection of wisdom does not cause the bodhisattva, the great being, to attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dor ba ma yin no //🔽rnam @87a * //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dor ba ma yin no // rnam @87a * //
translated: It does not cause him to abandon the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sprod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sprod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not bring about the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar chos kyi gnas nyid tshad mar byas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang bskyed pa ma yin 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi gnas nyid tshad mar byas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang bskyed pa ma yin 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, taking the reality of phenomena as the standard, this perfection of wisdom does not produce or stop any phenomenon.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos gang yang bskyed pa ma lags 'gog pa ma lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos gang yang bskyed pa ma lags 'gog pa ma lags na /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One, if this perfection of wisdom does not produce or stop any phenomenon,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, how should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom give gifts?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims bsrung bar bgyi /🔽ji ltar bzod pa bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims bsrung bar bgyi / ji ltar bzod pa bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they guard morality?🔽How should they cultivate patience?

original: ji ltar brtson 'grus brtsam par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson 'grus brtsam par bgyi /
translated: How should they undertake perseverance?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi /
translated: How should they become absorbed in concentration?

original: ji ltar shes rab bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “One should give gifts with the knowledge of all aspects in mind.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should guard morality with the knowledge of all aspects in mind.🔽One should cultivate patience with the knowledge of all aspects in mind.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
translated: One should undertake perseverance with the knowledge of all aspects in mind.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should enter into the meditative absorptions while focusing on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te shes rab bsgom par bya'o //🔽des dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //🔽ji ltar 'di la blo rnam pa gsum po sngo bar byed pa de ni su zhig yin la /🔽bsngo bar bya ba yang gang yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te shes rab bsgom par bya'o // des dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o // ji ltar 'di la blo rnam pa gsum po sngo bar byed pa de ni su zhig yin la / bsngo bar bya ba yang gang yin /
translated: One should cultivate wisdom while focusing on the knowledge of all aspects.🔽And one should dedicate those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, making them common to all sentient beings.

original: gang du yongs su bsngo bar bya ba yin snyam par mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang du yongs su bsngo bar bya ba yin snyam par mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: When the roots of goodness of the bodhisattva great beings are thus dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, the cultivation of the six perfections is completed,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i byar du 'gyur ba @87b dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i byar du 'gyur ba @87b dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the cultivation of love is completed, and the cultivation of the knowledge of all aspects is completed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who are not separated from the six perfections are not separated from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should practice the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections, having completed all the wholesome roots, will attain the knowledge of path aspects.

original: rab 'byor de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should be dedicated to the six perfections.”

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the concept of origination and cessation.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bgyi /
translated: “Lord, how are bodhisattva great beings dedicated to the six perfections?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings are not conjoined with form, nor are they disjoined from it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are not conjoined with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, nor are they disjoined from them.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are not conjoined with the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination, nor are they disjoined from them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are not conjoined with all the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, nor are they disjoined from them.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa @88a * //🔽yang ma yin /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa @88a * // yang ma yin /
translated: the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not conjoined and are not disjoined;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu brtag par bya ste /
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects are not conjoined and are not disjoined.”🔽“

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, should the bodhisattva great being exert himself in the six perfections.

original: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being should not exert himself thinking, ‘I will stand in form.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not exert himself thinking, ‘I will stand in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.’

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not exert himself thinking, ‘I will stand in the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.’

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not exert himself thinking, ‘I will stand in all the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.’

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang ; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang ; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: the five clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.’

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not make an effort thinking, ‘I will stand in the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not make an effort thinking, ‘I will stand in the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: Form does not stand anywhere.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not stand or not stand anywhere;

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination do not stand or not stand anywhere;

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening do not stand or not stand anywhere;

original: 'phags pa'i @88b bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i @88b bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, the emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness deliverances, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways do not stand or not stand anywhere;

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not stand anywhere.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni gang la yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni gang la yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects does not stand anywhere.🔽In that way, a bodhisattva great being should fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, without standing anywhere.”

original: de ltar mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin
analyzed: de ltar mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin
translated: This is the conception of standing in form, etc.

original: no; ; // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: no; ; // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: skyes bu zhig shing tog aa mra'am pa na sa za bar 'dod na des shing tog aa mra'am pa na sa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu zhig shing tog aa mra'am pa na sa za bar 'dod na des shing tog aa mra'am pa na sa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: if a man wants to eat mangoes or breadfruit, he should plant mango or breadfruit trees.

original: bskyed nas kyang dus dus su chus bcur bar bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed nas kyang dus dus su chus bcur bar bya'o //
translated: Having planted them, he should water them from time to time.

original: gnod pa bsal lo //
analyzed: gnod pa bsal lo //
translated: He should remove any harm.

original: de rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis mthar gyis 'phel nas shing tog aa mra'am shing tog pa na sa yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis mthar gyis 'phel nas shing tog aa mra'am shing tog pa na sa yod par 'gyur te /
translated: and by the power of the coming together of causes and conditions, it gradually grows, and finally becomes a mango or rose-apple tree.

original: de shing tog pa na sa za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shing tog pa na sa za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and one eats the rose-apple fruit.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment should train in the six perfections,

original: sems can rnams sbyin pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: and should help sentient beings with generosity.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: They should help them with morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: They should liberate sentient beings from cyclic existence.' This is the conception of the destruction of the family.

original: // / rab 'byor de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar 'dod pa dang / @89a * //
analyzed: // / rab 'byor de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar 'dod pa dang / @89a * //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to stand in the perfection of wisdom should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug par 'dod pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug par 'dod pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Those who want to stand in the perfection of concentration, perfection of perseverance, perfection of patience, perfection of morality, and perfection of giving should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsung ngam ;
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsung ngam ;
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, do you say that the perfection of wisdom should train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smras pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, I say that the perfection of wisdom should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba 'thob par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smra'o zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba med pa la rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba 'thob par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smra'o zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba med pa la rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conceptualization in the absence of a goal.

original: // / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: // / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba'i sa thob par 'gyur ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba'i sa thob par 'gyur ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That which is the perfection of wisdom is the stage of attaining mastery over all dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the gateway to all dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen po ni chu klung thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen po ni chu klung thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: For example, the great ocean is the gateway to all rivers.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is the gateway to all dharmas.

original: gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: Whether it is a person of the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: or a person of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,🔽or a person of the Great Vehicle,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and the bodhisattvas should train in just this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //🔽nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o // nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.🔽They should train in inner emptiness,🔽they should train in outer emptiness,🔽they should train in inner and outer emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o // phyi nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in the emptiness of emptiness,🔽they should train in great emptiness,🔽they should train in the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽they should train in the emptiness of the compounded,🔽they should train in the emptiness of the uncompounded,🔽they should train in the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽they should train in the emptiness of the beginningless and endless,🔽they should train in the emptiness of nonrepudiation,🔽they should train in the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽they should train in the emptiness of all things,🔽they should train in the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽they should train in the emptiness of nonapprehension,🔽they should train in the emptiness of nonexistence,🔽they should train in the emptiness of essential nature,🔽they should train in the emptiness of other things,🔽they should train in the emptiness of the nonapprehension of nonthings,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in the four applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bya'o //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / @89b bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bya'o // 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / @89b bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: “One should train in the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “One should train in the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “One should train in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽One should train in the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa la rnam par rtog pa yin no /🔽// / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa la rnam par rtog pa yin no / // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: This is a conceptualization that has no cause.

original: 'phong gi slob dpon lag tshod dang 'byor pa'i gzhu thogs pa ni dgra dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
analyzed: 'phong gi slob dpon lag tshod dang 'byor pa'i gzhu thogs pa ni dgra dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is just as when a master archer, holding a bow that is well-strung and well-fitted to his hand, is difficult to overcome for enemies and adversaries.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom is difficult to overcome for Māra or the gods in Māra’s retinue.

original: rab 'byor de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla ma med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla ma med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: “Thus, the lord buddhas of the past, future, and present pay attention to those who practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gsol pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: gsol pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “How do the lord buddhas pay attention to bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving?”

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How does he intend to teach the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How does he intend to teach the practice of inner emptiness,

original: ji ltar dngos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: and how does he intend to teach the practice of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of intrinsic nature?

original: @90a * // ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: @90a * // ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How does he intend to teach the practice of the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the correct liberations, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang // gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang // gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: the clairvoyances, the concentrations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: how he sets his mind on the practice of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: and how he sets his mind on the practice of the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, it is because of the emptiness of internal phenomena that he sets his mind on the practice of the perfection of giving.

original: rab 'byor 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: Subhūti, the lord buddhas pay attention to the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving.

original: ci nas kyang sbyin pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang sbyin pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: They pay attention in such a way that giving is not apprehended.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: They pay attention to the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: They pay attention in such a way that wisdom is not apprehended.

original: nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: They pay attention to the practice of inner emptiness.

original: ci nas kyang nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do ;
analyzed: ci nas kyang nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do ;
translated: They pay attention in such a way that inner emptiness is not apprehended.

original: / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stod pa nyid kyi bar du spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stod pa nyid kyi bar du spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: ci nas kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He thinks about how to practice so that, in the end, he does not apprehend anything up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: He thinks about how to practice the applications of mindfulness.

original: ci nas kyang @90b dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang @90b dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He thinks about how to practice so that, in the end, he does not apprehend the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de ;
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de ;
translated: He thinks about how to practice the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: ci nas kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He thinks about how to practice so that, in the end, he does not apprehend the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He has the intention to practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He has the intention to practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽He has the intention to practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /🔽ci nas kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de / ci nas kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He has the intention to practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽He has the intention to practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He has the intention to practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽He has the intention to practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He has the intention to practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽He has the intention to practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He has the intention to practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽He has the intention to practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /🔽ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /🔽ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He has the intention to practice the thirty-seven

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ci nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: ci nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: And they do so in such a way that the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: It is in this way that the bodhisattva great beings are attended to by the buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la gzugs su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la gzugs su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the lord buddhas do not attend to the bodhisattva great beings as form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not attend to them as feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang ; khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: skye mched dang ; khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not attend to them as the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not attend to them as the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan @91a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan @91a * //
translated: He does not intend the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditation,

original: gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: or the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not intend inner emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: outer emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not intend the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, or the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgor dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgor dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not intend the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He does not intend up to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: This is the conception of the dharma of opponents.

original: 'di dag gis ni 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
translated: These explain the two conceptions of grasping in nine aspects.

original: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
translated: “Lord, this perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o /
translated: Lord, those bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening do the difficult thing.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid la gnas pa zhes bgyi ba ni 'ga' yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid la gnas pa zhes bgyi ba ni 'ga' yang ma mchis te /
translated: Lord, there is no one at all who is called ‘standing in suchness’;

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'ga' yang ma mchis /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'ga' yang ma mchis /
translated: there is no one at all who fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening;

original: chos ston pa yang 'ga' yang ma mchis mod kyi /
analyzed: chos ston pa yang 'ga' yang ma mchis mod kyi /
translated: and there is no one at all who teaches the Dharma.

original: de lta na yang de zhum par mi 'gyur zhing nem nur du @91b 'gyur ba'am rmongs par 'gyur ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //🔽de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽koo shi ka gang khyod kyis 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos zab mo 'di dag la nem nur du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang de zhum par mi 'gyur zhing nem nur du @91b 'gyur ba'am rmongs par 'gyur ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o // de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so // koo shi ka gang khyod kyis 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos zab mo 'di dag la nem nur du mi 'gyur /
translated: And why? Because they do not become fainthearted, nor do they become timid or confused.🔽Then the elder Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika, you have said, ‘Blessed One, it is hard for bodhisattva great beings not to be timid,

original: rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes gsol pa ni /
analyzed: rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes gsol pa ni /
translated: not to be fearful, and not to be doubtful about these deep dharmas.’

original: koo shi ka chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na de la nem nur du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na de la nem nur du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Kauśika, all dharmas are empty, so what would be timid,

original: rmongs par 'gyur ba lta su zhig yod /🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rmongs par 'gyur ba lta su zhig yod / brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: what would be fearful, and what would be doubtful?

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni gang ci ston kyang de thams cad ni stong pa nyid las brtsams shing ston te /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni gang ci ston kyang de thams cad ni stong pa nyid las brtsams shing ston te /
translated: Śatakratu then said, “The elder Subhūti teaches whatever he teaches, all of it based on emptiness.

original: ci la yang chags pa med do //
analyzed: ci la yang chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to anything at all.

original: 'di lta ste dper na bar snang la 'phangs pa'i mda' ni ci la yang chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na bar snang la 'phangs pa'i mda' ni ci la yang chags pa med do //
translated: For example, an arrow shot into the air will not stick to anything.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bstan pa yang ci la yang chags pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bstan pa yang ci la yang chags pa med do //
translated: In the same way, the teaching of the Dharma by the elder Subhūti will not stick to anything.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags /🔽bdag gis de skad du gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags / bdag gis de skad du gsol te /
translated: “Lord, is it that

original: de skad du brjod pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pa dang / chos rjes su brjed cing chos kyis gnyer ba'i chos nyid yang dag par lung bstan pas lung bstan par 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: de skad du brjod pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pa dang / chos rjes su brjed cing chos kyis gnyer ba'i chos nyid yang dag par lung bstan pas lung bstan par 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: I have said this, and that by saying this I have repeated what the Lord has said, and that I have been inspired by the inspiration of the Dharma, and that I have been bidden welcome by the Tathāgata?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka gang khyod kyis de skad du smras te de skad du brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang khyod kyis de skad du smras te de skad du brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pas /
translated: “Kauśika, it is because you have said this, and by saying this you have repeated what the Tathāgata has said,

original: chos su brjod cing chos su gnyer ba'i chos nyid lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos su brjod cing chos su gnyer ba'i chos nyid lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Dharma is taught and the Dharma is sought in the Dharma-element which is indicated.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu then said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gnas brtan rab 'byor 'dis ci dang ci spobs pa de thams cad stong pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnas brtan rab 'byor 'dis ci dang ci spobs pa de thams cad stong pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs /
translated: “Lord, whatever this elder Subhūti has expounded, he has expounded it all starting from emptiness.

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs /
translated: He has expounded it starting from signlessness,

original: smon pa ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs /
analyzed: smon pa ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs /
translated: starting from wishlessness, and starting from the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @92a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @92a * //
translated: starting from the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the aspects of liberation, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,🔽and aspirationlessness; the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways;

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the aspects of correct understanding,🔽and the distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du brtsams shing spobs pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du brtsams shing spobs pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: and up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor stong pa nyid la rnam par spyod pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na ;
analyzed: koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor stong pa nyid la rnam par spyod pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na ;
translated: “Kauśika, the elder Subhūti, who practices the emptiness, does not apprehend the perfection of giving,

original: gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone someone who practices the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na ;
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na ;
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone someone who practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: He does not apprehend inner emptiness,

original: gang nang stong pa nyid kyang sgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang nang stong pa nyid kyang sgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone someone who meditates on inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yang mi dmigs na /
translated: He does not apprehend . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar @92b la sgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar @92b la sgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could they possibly cultivate the emptiness of essential nature of non-entities?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The applications of mindfulness are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could they possibly cultivate the applications of mindfulness?

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang mi dmigs na /
translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are non-apprehensible,

original: gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could they possibly cultivate the eightfold noble path?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The noble truths, meditative stabilizations, and formless absorptions are non-apprehensible,

original: gang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la sgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la sgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could they possibly cultivate the formless absorptions?

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the gateways of mnemonic incantation, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: gang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la sgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la sgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: the meditative development of the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: the accomplishment of the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the four fearlessnesses,

original: gang mi 'jigs pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang mi 'jigs pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: the accomplishment of the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: gang so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: the accomplishment of the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: snying rje chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: snying rje chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: great compassion,

original: gang snying rje chen po la rnam par spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang snying rje chen po la rnam par spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who practice great compassion!

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “The distinct qualities of the Buddha are also non-apprehensible,

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who would accomplish the distinct qualities of the Buddha!

original: byang chub nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “Enlightenment itself is also non-apprehensible,

original: gang byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who would fully awaken to enlightenment!

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “Omniscience itself is also non-apprehensible,

original: gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who would attain omniscience!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “The Thus-Gone One himself is also non-apprehensible,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who would become a thus-gone one!

original: ma skyes pa nyid kyang mi @93a * //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid kyang mi @93a * //
translated: “Non-arising itself is also non-apprehensible,

original: dmigs na / gang ma skyes pa mngon du byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: dmigs na / gang ma skyes pa mngon du byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who would actualize non-arising!

original: mtshan rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mtshan rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “The major marks are also non-apprehensible,

original: gang gi lus la mtshan yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gi lus la mtshan yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those whose bodies would have the major marks!

original: dpe byad rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dpe byad rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: If even the major marks are not apprehended,

original: gang gi lus la dpe byad yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gi lus la dpe byad yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: how could there be a body on which the major marks are based?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor ni chos thams cad dben pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor ni chos thams cad dben pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, the elder Subhūti is established in the voidness of all phenomena,

original: dmigs su med pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa la gnas pa /
translated: he is established in the non-apprehensible,

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pa /
translated: he is established in emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa la rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rnam par spyod pa /
translated: he is engaged in signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa la rnam par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la rnam par spyod pa ste /
translated: he is engaged in wishlessness.

original: koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi gnas pa gang yin pa des ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa la brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi gnas pa gang yin pa des ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa la brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: Kauśika, the bodhisattva great beings’ practice of the perfection of wisdom and the practice of the practice of the perfection of wisdom do not approach even a hundredth part of the elder Subhūti’s practice.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / rgyu dang / dper yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / rgyu dang / dper yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach a hundredth part, or a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part of that, or any number, fraction, analogy, or likeness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang ; nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang ; nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang /
