translated: Except for the Tathāgata’s way of life, the way of life of a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom, and the way of life of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa'i rnam par spyod pa de dag las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid ni mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa'i rnam par spyod pa de dag las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid ni mchog ces bya'o //
translated: and the way of life of the pratyekabuddhas, this very way of life of a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom is called the best,

original: rab ces bya'o //🔽phul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab ces bya'o // phul zhes bya'o //
translated: the most excellent,🔽the foremost,🔽the highest,

original: dam pa zhes bya'o //🔽gya chom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya'o //🔽gya chom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the sublime,🔽the matchless,🔽and the unsurpassable.

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: unsurpassed,

original: gong na med pa /
analyzed: gong na med pa /
translated: highest,

original: mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa /
translated: without equal,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and without comparison.

original: koo shi ka de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'dod pas 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'dod pas 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par spyad par bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings who wish to be the foremost of all beings should practice this very practice, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa @93b las 'das te /
analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa @93b las 'das te /
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings practicing this perfection of wisdom go beyond the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: and enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, they will complete the buddhadharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having perfected the qualities of a Buddha, they will attain the wisdom of omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su thob nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su thob nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam
translated: Having attained the wisdom of omniscience, they will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Fully Enlightened Buddha, who has abandoned all afflictive emotions and the habitual tendencies.

original: gyi phan yon yin no /
analyzed: gyi phan yon yin no /
translated: This is the benefit of the path of seeing.

original: // / de nas 'khor de'i nang nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyis me tog man d'a ra ba mang po thogs te /
analyzed: // / de nas 'khor de'i nang nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyis me tog man d'a ra ba mang po thogs te /
translated: Then, from within the assembly, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three took up many coral tree flowers

original: bcom ldan 'das la gtor to //🔽mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gtor to // mngon par gtor to //
translated: and scattered them over the Bhagavān.🔽They scattered them over him.

original: rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: rab tu gtor to //
translated: They scattered them over him.

original: dge slong brgya phrag drug cu rtsam yang stan las langs nas chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar te /
analyzed: dge slong brgya phrag drug cu rtsam yang stan las langs nas chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar te /
translated: Also, sixty thousand bhikṣus rose from their seats, removed their upper robe from one shoulder,

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /
translated: He knelt on his right knee,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la mig mi 'dzums par blta zhing phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la mig mi 'dzums par blta zhing phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and with his palms joined in reverence he bowed to the Blessed One and gazed upon him with unblinking eyes.

original: dge slong de dag gis thal mo sbyar te btud pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus snyim pa me tog man d'a ra bas gang bar gyur nas man d'a ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor🔽to // mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis thal mo sbyar te btud pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus snyim pa me tog man d'a ra bas gang bar gyur nas man d'a ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor to // mngon par gtor to //
translated: When those monks bowed with their palms joined, through the power of the Buddha their cupped hands became filled with coral tree flowers. They scattered those coral tree flowers over the Thus-Gone One, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha.🔽They scattered them,

original: rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: rab tu gtor to //
translated: they scattered them well,

original: de ltar 'thor zhing mngon par 'thor ba dang / rab tu 'thor ba'i tshe tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar 'thor zhing mngon par 'thor ba dang / rab tu 'thor ba'i tshe tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: and as they scattered them, they uttered this verse:🔽“The one who has the ten powers, the one with the four types of fearlessness,

original: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma lags pa'i gnas dam pas bdag cag gnas par gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slang de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma lags pa'i gnas dam pas bdag cag gnas par gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slang de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts of those monks, smiled.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid kyis kyang de ste /🔽de ltar 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas 'di lta ste /🔽'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel @94a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid kyis kyang de ste / de ltar 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas 'di lta ste / 'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel @94a * //
translated: It is the nature of the blessed buddhas that🔽when they smile, various blue, yellow, red, white, purple, crystal,🔽silver, and golden light rays emerge from their mouths.

original: dang ; dngul gyi kha dog lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs byung ste de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang nas phyir 'dus te /
analyzed: dang ; dngul gyi kha dog lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs byung ste de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang nas phyir 'dus te /
translated: Those light rays pervade and fill the entire trichiliocosm, and then return.

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub bo //
translated: He circumambulated the Bhagavān three times and then disappeared into the crown of the Bhagavān’s head.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, removed his robe from one shoulder,🔽and knelt on his right knee.

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: With his palms together he bowed toward the Bhagavān

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and asked the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
translated: “Bhagavān, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas do not smile without a cause or condition.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ci lags rkyen ci lags zhes gsol to //
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ci lags rkyen ci lags zhes gsol to //
translated: What is the cause? What is the condition for the smile?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said to the venerable Ānanda,🔽“Ānanda, do you see the young man who has come here with a question?”

original: kun dga' bo dge slong brgya phrag drug cu po 'di dag bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong brgya phrag drug cu po 'di dag bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: Ananda, these six hundred monks will attain supreme awakening in the eon called Star-like.

original: me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will appear in the world as the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones called Flower-rain.

original: kun dga' bo me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun dga' bo me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: Ananda, the saṅgha of monks of those Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones called Flower-rain will be equal.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: Their buddha-fields will be equal.

original: tshe'i tshad kyang 'di lta ste lo stong du mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyang 'di lta ste lo stong du mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Their lifespans will be equal, namely one thousand years.

original: de dag gang dang gang nas mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dang de dag tu me tog kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i me tog gi char mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gang dang gang nas mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dang de dag tu me tog kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i me tog gi char mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: And wherever they come forth, having come forth, go forth, and having gone forth, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, there a rain of flowers with five different colors falls.

original: kun dga' bo de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par spyod pa'i dam pas spyod @94b par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par spyod pa'i dam pas spyod @94b par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, bodhisattva great beings who want to practice the highest practice should practice this perfection of wisdom.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po la gzhan la ston pa'i byed pa dang po
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po la gzhan la ston pa'i byed pa dang po
translated: This is the first activity of teaching others about great enlightenment.

original: yin no // kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo des 'di ltar bdag ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa'am /
analyzed: yin no // kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo des 'di ltar bdag ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa'am /
translated: “Ānanda, the sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who practice this profound perfection of wisdom should think, ‘I have died in the human realm and been reborn here,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa ste /
translated: or I have died in the Tuṣita paradise and been reborn here.

original: mi'i nang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'am /
analyzed: mi'i nang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'am /
translated: In the human realm I heard this profound perfection of wisdom extensively,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Ānanda, you should know that those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom have heard this profound perfection of wisdom extensively in the god realm of the Heaven of Joy.”

original: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzigs par blta ste /🔽kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzigs par blta ste / kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Ānanda, you should know that the Thus-Gone One sees those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom.🔽“Ānanda, if any son or daughter of noble family listens to this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang /
translated: after listening, takes it up, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, properly pays attention to it, and

original: gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston zhing rjes su 'doms pa'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa des bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs
analyzed: gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston zhing rjes su 'doms pa'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa des bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs
translated: The bodhisattva who teaches and instructs bodhisattvas in this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom is a bodhisattva who has been predicted by the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones to attain unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par 'gyur /
translated: “Ānanda, the bodhisattva great beings who teach and instruct the bodhisattva great beings in this profound perfection of wisdom should know that those bodhisattva great beings have heard this profound perfection of wisdom from the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas,

original: bzung pa dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa gyur te /
analyzed: bzung pa dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa gyur te /
translated: have taken it up, borne it in mind, read it aloud, mastered it,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya ste /🔽kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya ste / kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and have planted many wholesome roots with those tathāgatas, those arhats, those perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu mo des bdag gis ni nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo des bdag gis ni nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
translated: “Ānanda, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family should know that they have not planted wholesome roots with the śrāvakas,

original: nyan thos rnams las @95a * //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams las @95a * //
translated: and that they have not heard this profound perfection of wisdom from the śrāvakas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, you should know that those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage have not heard this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / don dang chos dang yi ge dang mthun par khong du chud par byed na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / don dang chos dang yi ge dang mthun par khong du chud par byed na /
translated: “Ānanda, if any sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage were to hold, maintain, recite, understand, and be attentive to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom in the appropriate manner, in terms of its meaning, its teaching, and its words,

original: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des bdag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des bdag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage should understand that they have actually encountered the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas.

original: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bstan pa 'di thos na phyir mi ldog cing don du mi brjod la /
analyzed: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bstan pa 'di thos na phyir mi ldog cing don du mi brjod la /
translated: “Ānanda, if any sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage, on hearing this teaching of the profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, do not regress and do not express its meaning,

original: thos nas kyang mos pa thob par gyur na /
analyzed: thos nas kyang mos pa thob par gyur na /
translated: and having heard it, they attain faith.

original: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa /
translated: Ānanda, you should know that those sons of good family or daughters of good family have served the Victors of the past,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: have planted the roots of virtue, and have been taken hold of by the spiritual benefactors.

original: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta yang mi slu ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta yang mi slu ste /
translated: Ānanda, those sons of good family or daughters of good family who have planted the roots of virtue in the presence of the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas, will not be deceived.

original: nyan thos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos sam /
translated: They will become Śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas sam /
translated: or Pratyekabuddhas,

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: or Buddhas.

original: 'on kyang kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: But, Ānanda, those Bodhisattva Great Beings who practice the perfection of giving, who practice the perfection of morality, who practice the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom; all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan @95b ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pas ni shin tu rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan @95b ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pas ni shin tu rtogs par bya ste /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and up to the knowledge of all aspects, they are not fully awakened.🔽

original: shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /

translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong bar rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa dang / rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa ni nyan thos sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong bar rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa dang / rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa ni nyan thos sam /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the eightfold noble path,🔽up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and up to omniscience, they will not become śrāvakas or

original: rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: pratyekabuddhas.

original: kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de /
translated: Therefore, Ananda, I entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you.

original: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis ngas chos gang ji snyed cig bshad pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par ngas chos thams cad bstan pa de dag thams cad bzung ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis ngas chos gang ji snyed cig bshad pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par ngas chos thams cad bstan pa de dag thams cad bzung ste /
translated: Ananda, if you were to retain and master all the teachings I have given, except for the perfection of wisdom,

original: kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu chud gsan te bor yang de tsam gyis kun dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu chud gsan te bor yang de tsam gyis kun dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du mi brtsi'o //
translated: and then forget and lose them, I would not consider that a fault of yours.

original: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste /🔽kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu tshig gcig tsam chud gsan tam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste / kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu tshig gcig tsam chud gsan tam /
translated: Ananda, if you were to retain and master this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: bor bar gyur na /
analyzed: bor bar gyur na /
translated: and then forget and lose even just a single word,

original: de tsam gyis ni kun dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du bzung ngo //🔽kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @96a * //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni kun dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du bzung ngo // kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @96a * //
translated: I would consider that a fault of yours.

original: 'di khyod la gtad kyis /
analyzed: 'di khyod la gtad kyis /
translated: Therefore, Ananda, I entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you.

original: ci nas kyang gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / shin tu yid la bzung ba gyis shig / legs par yongs su zin pa dang / legs par kun chub pa dang / legs par bcang bar gyis shig / yi ge dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / shin tu yid la bzung ba gyis shig / legs par yongs su zin pa dang / legs par kun chub pa dang / legs par bcang bar gyis shig / yi ge dang /
translated: and you must hold it well, master it well, and keep it well.🔽You must hold the letters,

original: tshig dang / 'bru shin tu rdzogs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig legs par shin tu zin par bya'o //🔽kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang ; kun chub par byed pa de ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang /
analyzed: tshig dang / 'bru shin tu rdzogs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig legs par shin tu zin par bya'o // kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang ; kun chub par byed pa de ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang /
translated: the words, and the syllables well, and you must hold the etymological definitions well.

original: da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Ānanda, any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who holds, keeps, reads, and masters this deep perfection of wisdom will hold the awakening of the lord buddhas of the past, future, and present.

original: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub mthun par yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub mthun par yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Ānanda, any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who wants to honor,🔽revere, respect, and make offerings to me, who is present, with flowers,

original: kun dga' bo mngon du gyur pa gang nga la me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang ; rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya ba dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bo mngon du gyur pa gang nga la me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang ; rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya ba dang /
translated: garlands, perfume, powder, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,🔽should take up this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pas des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gzung bar bya /🔽bcang bar bya /
analyzed: bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pas des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gzung bar bya / bcang bar bya /
translated: should bear it in mind,

original: bklag par bya /
analyzed: bklag par bya /
translated: should read it aloud,

original: kun chub par bya'o //
analyzed: kun chub par bya'o //
translated: and should master it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste bcangs nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste bcangs nas /
translated: Having taken up this profound perfection of wisdom, they should bear it in mind,

original: bklags shing kun chub par byas te /
analyzed: bklags shing kun chub par byas te /
translated: read it aloud, master it,

original: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya /🔽bkur stir bya /
analyzed: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya / bkur stir bya /
translated: and honor it with flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, aromatic powders, clothing, parasols, victory banners, and flags.🔽They should respect it,

original: bsti stang du bya /
analyzed: bsti stang du bya /
translated: honor it,

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //
translated: and worship it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod par byas na des ni nga yang mchod par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod par byas na des ni nga yang mchod par 'gyur /
translated: If they honor, respect, venerate, and worship the perfection of wisdom, they will also honor me.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mchod @96b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mchod @96b par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also honor the past, future, and present buddha bhagavāns.

original: kun dga' bo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos ba skyes pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos ba skyes pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang /
translated: Ananda, whoever has given rise to respect,🔽delight, and interest in this teaching of the profound perfection of wisdom, has given rise to respect,

original: dga' ba dang / mos pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mos pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: delight, and interest in the past, future, and present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: kun dga' bo gal te khyod nga la sdug cing yid du 'ong ba yongs su mi gtang zhe na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te khyod nga la sdug cing yid du 'ong ba yongs su mi gtang zhe na /
translated: Ananda, if you love me and do not want to abandon me,🔽Ananda, you should not abandon this perfection of wisdom, which is loved and pleasing to me.

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba yongs su mi btang ba gyis shig / ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las tshig 'ga' yang khyod kyis chud ma
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba yongs su mi btang ba gyis shig / ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las tshig 'ga' yang khyod kyis chud ma
translated: Do not let a single word of this profound perfection of wisdom be lost to you.

original: zos par gyis shig / kun dga' bo ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gtad par brtsams te /
analyzed: zos par gyis shig / kun dga' bo ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gtad par brtsams te /
translated: Ananda, I have begun to entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you.

original: khyod la shin tu mang du bstan pa yang mdor na kun dga' bo khyod la ngas ji ltar ston par 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang khyod kyis ston pa yin gyis kun dga' bo de bas na ngas khyod la
analyzed: khyod la shin tu mang du bstan pa yang mdor na kun dga' bo khyod la ngas ji ltar ston par 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang khyod kyis ston pa yin gyis kun dga' bo de bas na ngas khyod la
translated: In brief, Ānanda, just as I teach you, this perfection of wisdom also teaches you.🔽Therefore, Ānanda, I entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you

original: tshad med par gtad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su gtad de /
analyzed: tshad med par gtad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su gtad de /
translated: in order to give it to you without measure.

original: kun dga' bo de bas na lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mdun du brjod do ;
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mdun du brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, I declare this in the presence of the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: / sus sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su ma btang ba dang /
analyzed: / sus sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su ma btang ba dang /
translated: Whoever does not abandon the Buddha, does not abandon the Dharma, does not abandon the Saṅgha, and does not abandon the blessed buddhas of the past, future, and present,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yongs su ma btang ba des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gtang bar mi bya ste 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yongs su ma btang ba des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gtang bar mi bya ste 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go //
translated: “Ānanda, that which is the non-abandonment of the enlightenment of the past, future, and present lord buddhas, that should not be abandoned by you with regard to this perfection of wisdom. This is my instruction.

original: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
translated: “Ānanda, any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / gzhan la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rnam grangs du mar rgya cher pa dang / ston pa dang / @97a * //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / gzhan la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rnam grangs du mar rgya cher pa dang / ston pa dang / @97a * //
translated: and properly pays attention to this deep perfection of wisdom, and also teaches it to others in detail,

original: rab tu ston pa dang / shes par byed pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'brel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: rab tu ston pa dang / shes par byed pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'brel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: Those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family who teach this perfection of wisdom, who make it known, who establish it, who reveal it, who explain it, who make it clear, who make it evident, and who demonstrate it will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: They will have approached the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of the lord buddhas comes from the perfection of wisdom.

original: kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha🔽rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
translated: “Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of those lord buddhas, those tathāgatas, those saints, those perfectly awakened ones, who have appeared in the past, has come from this perfection of wisdom.🔽“Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of those lord buddhas, those tathāgatas, those saints, those perfectly awakened ones, who will appear in the future, will come from this perfection of wisdom.

original: kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: “Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of those lord buddhas, those tathāgatas, those saints, those perfectly awakened ones, who are now present, has come from this perfection of wisdom.”

original: / kun dga' bo da ltar byung ba'i dus na shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
analyzed: / kun dga' bo da ltar byung ba'i dus na shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
translated: “Ānanda, in the present, in the eastern, southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, northwestern, lower and upper directions, in infinite, countless world systems, there are as many tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River who are alive, live, and will live,

original: chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
analyzed: chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
translated: and the unsurpassed, perfect complete enlightenment of those lord buddhas who are alive, live, and will live, teaching the Dharma, has come from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: kun dga' bo de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Ananda, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who wants to fully know the supreme enlightenment, and who wants to train in the six perfections, should train in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe @97b na ;🔽kun dga' bo 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe @97b na ; kun dga' bo 'di lta ste /
translated: And why?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma ste skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma ste skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, she gives birth to them.

original: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Ananda, all those Bodhisattvas, great beings, who train in the six perfections, they all will go forth to the supreme enlightenment.

original: kun dga' bo de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang yongs su gtad do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang yongs su gtad do //
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, I entrust these six perfections to you again and again.

original: rjes su gtad do //
analyzed: rjes su gtad do //
translated: I give them to you.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod mi zad pa'i mdzod de /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod mi zad pa'i mdzod de /
translated: Ānanda, this is the inexhaustible treasure of the Dharma of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened ones.

original: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdzod do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdzod do //
translated: It is this perfection of wisdom, this treasure.

original: kun dga' bo phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na /
translated: Ānanda, in the worlds in the ten directions, in countless, immeasurable, and limitless world systems,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod 'di las chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod 'di las chos ston to //
translated: the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened, and blessed buddhas who are present, who remain, who live, who are alive, and who teach the Dharma—those lord buddhas teach the Dharma from this treasure of the six perfections.

original: kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs🔽pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te chos ston to //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te chos ston to //
translated: “Ānanda, all the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past, as many as there are, trained in this very perfection of wisdom and fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and taught the Dharma.🔽“Ānanda, all the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the future, as many as there are, will train in this very perfection of wisdom and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and teach the Dharma.

original: kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Ānanda, all the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the present, in all ten directions and in all world systems, as many as there are, have trained in this very perfection of wisdom and fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and teach the Dharma.”

original: kun dga' bo 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to // yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: future, and present lord buddhas, however many there may be, have attained complete nirvāṇa through this very perfection of wisdom.🔽They will attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las @98a * //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las @98a * //
translated: They are attaining complete nirvāṇa.”

original: 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su gtad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su gtad pa yin no //
translated: This is the entrustment of the perfection of wisdom, the cause of great awakening.

original: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa ba rnams la nyan thos kyi sa las brtsams te chos ston pa'i chos bstan pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa ba rnams la nyan thos kyi sa las brtsams te chos ston pa'i chos bstan pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams
translated: “Ānanda, if you were to teach the Dharma to individuals who are followers of the vehicle of the hearers, beginning with the level of the hearers, and if that teaching of the Dharma were to cause all the sentient beings in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm to attain the level of the śrāvaka arhat,

original: cad dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur kyang da dung nyan thos kyis nga'i nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: cad dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur kyang da dung nyan thos kyis nga'i nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if all of them were to actualize the state of an arhat, they would still not have done what a śrāvaka of mine should do.

original: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ga' zhig brjod pa de bstan kyang nyan thos kyis nga dgyes par byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ga' zhig brjod pa de bstan kyang nyan thos kyis nga dgyes par byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Ānanda, if you were to teach even a single word related to the perfection of wisdom to a bodhisattva great being, that would be a greater service to me than that.

original: nyan thos kyis nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: A śrāvaka would have done what a śrāvaka of mine should do.

original: kun dga' bo de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Ānanda, what do you think?

original: chos bstan pa snga ma des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
analyzed: chos bstan pa snga ma des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
translated: If all the sentient beings in the worlds of a great billionfold universe were to attain a human body, and

original: mi'i lus thob nas kyang dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byas par gyur na /
analyzed: mi'i lus thob nas kyang dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byas par gyur na /
translated: after attaining a human body were to actualize the state of an arhat,

original: dgra bcom pa de dag gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mang ngam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa de dag gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mang ngam /
translated: “Those worthy ones have a lot of merit that comes from generosity, a lot of merit that comes from morality, and a lot of merit that comes from meditation.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, it is a lot.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: Well-Gone One, it is a lot.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo de bas gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
translated: “Ānanda, a person in the Śrāvaka Vehicle who teaches a bodhisattva great being the perfection of wisdom for even a single day

original: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //🔽kun dga' bo nyin gcig lta zhog gi gal te nyi ma phyed dam /
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro // kun dga' bo nyin gcig lta zhog gi gal te nyi ma phyed dam /
translated: would have a lot more merit than that.🔽Ānanda, forget about a single day. If someone were to teach for half a day,

original: kun dga' bo nyi ma phyed lta zhog gi / gal te snga dro gcig gam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo nyi ma phyed lta zhog gi / gal te snga dro gcig gam /
translated: Ānanda, forget about half a day. If someone were to teach for a single morning,

original: kun dga' bo snga dro gcig lta zhog gi / gal te chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo snga dro gcig lta zhog gi / gal te chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
translated: Ananda, let alone a morning, if for just one watch of the night,

original: kun dga' bo chu tshod gcig tsam lta zhog gi / gal te skad cig gam /🔽thang cig gam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo chu tshod gcig tsam lta zhog gi / gal te skad cig gam / thang cig gam /
translated: Ananda, let alone a watch of the night, if for just a moment,🔽a second,

original: yud tsam mam /
analyzed: yud tsam mam /
translated: a minute,

original: tha na mig 'dzums @98b pa tsam gyi tshod du yang gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan na /
analyzed: tha na mig 'dzums @98b pa tsam gyi tshod du yang gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan na /
translated: or even just the time it takes to blink the eyes, if a person of the Hearers’ Vehicle were to teach the Dharma endowed with the perfection of wisdom to a bodhisattva great being,

original: kun dga' bo de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Ananda, his merit would increase much more than that.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang des zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang des zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would surpass the wholesome roots of all those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the vehicles of the hearers and the solitary realizers.

original: kun dga' bo gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la chung du na nyi ma gcig gam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la chung du na nyi ma gcig gam /
translated: Ananda, if a bodhisattva great being teaches the Dharma endowed with the perfection of wisdom to bodhisattva great beings for even a single day,

original: nyi ma phyed dam /
analyzed: nyi ma phyed dam /
translated: or half a day,

original: snga dro gcig gam /🔽chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: snga dro gcig gam / chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
translated: or a morning,🔽or an hour,🔽or a few moments,🔽or a few instants,

original: skad 'ga'/ yud 'ga'/🔽thang 'ga' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
analyzed: skad 'ga'/ yud 'ga'/ thang 'ga' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
translated: or a few seconds,

original: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
translated: then, Ananda, that bodhisattva great being outshines the wholesome roots of all the sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the vehicle of the hearers and in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la /
translated: It is because they aspire to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening themselves.

original: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par dga' bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par dga' bar byed pa yin /
translated: Moreover, they cause others to delight in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzengs bstod / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug / yang dag par 'god par byed /
analyzed: gzengs bstod / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug / yang dag par 'god par byed /
translated: They encourage them, cause them to take it up, cause them to be established in it,

original: yang dag par rab tu gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: and cause them to be firmly established in it.

original: kun dga' bo de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
translated: Ānanda, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that practice the six perfections, practice the four establishments in mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: the five faculties, the five powers, the seven limbs of awakening, the eightfold noble path, the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / @99a * //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / @99a * //
translated: the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med skabs med de de ni gnas ma yin
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med skabs med de de ni gnas ma yin
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and the knowledge of all aspects, those who practice with many roots of virtue will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. There is no opportunity for that. That is not possible.

original: no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / nam mkha' lding dang /
analyzed: no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / nam mkha' lding dang /
translated: When this perfection of wisdom was being taught, the Blessed One, in the presence of the fourfold retinue and the gods, humans, asuras, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, garuḍas,

original: mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po de ltar 'khod pa rnams kyi mdun du rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang mngon par 'du mdzad pas /
analyzed: mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po de ltar 'khod pa rnams kyi mdun du rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang mngon par 'du mdzad pas /
translated: kinnaras, and mahoragas who were gathered there, manifested a miraculous display.

original: thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu 'khrugs pa med pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu 'khrugs pa med pa /
translated: Through that miraculous display, all of them saw the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya, who was like an unperturbed ocean, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas,

original: kun kyang dgra bcom pa /🔽zag pa med pa /
analyzed: kun kyang dgra bcom pa / zag pa med pa /
translated: all of whom were arhats,🔽free from defilements,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: free from afflictions,

original: dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa /
translated: in control of themselves,

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: with their minds completely liberated,

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /🔽cang shes pa /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba / cang shes pa /
translated: with their wisdom completely liberated,🔽with all their training completed,

original: glang po chen po /🔽bya ba byas pa /🔽byed pa byas pa /
analyzed: glang po chen po / bya ba byas pa / byed pa byas pa /
translated: great elephants,🔽with their work done,

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: with their tasks accomplished,🔽having laid down their burden,

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: It is the attainment of one's own goal.🔽

original: srid par sbyor ba /
analyzed: srid par sbyor ba /
translated: who had attained their own goal,🔽who were free from the bonds of existence,

original: yongs su zad pa dang / yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: yongs su zad pa dang / yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: who had completely exhausted their existence, who had completely understood, whose minds were completely liberated,

original: sems can thams cad la dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa sha stag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha stag gis kun nas bskor zhing mdun du bdar ba mthong bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa sha stag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha stag gis kun nas bskor zhing mdun du bdar ba mthong bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad do //
translated: who had attained the highest perfection of power over all sentient beings, and who were surrounded and attended by a saṅgha of bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur to /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur to /
translated: Then the Bhagavān withdrew that miracle.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur nas /
translated: When he withdrew that miracle,

original: 'khor bzhi po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @99b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa de yang ma mthong /
analyzed: 'khor bzhi po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @99b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa de yang ma mthong /
translated: the fourfold assembly no longer saw the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Akṣobhya,

original: gang zag nyan thos sam /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos sam /
translated: He did not see the person who was a śrāvaka or

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: a bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: He did not see the buddha realm of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun yang mig lam du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun yang mig lam du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: The Buddha and the community of monks also disappeared from the range of his vision.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why was that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa phyir brtul bar mdzad pas de'i phyir de dag gis ma mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa phyir brtul bar mdzad pas de'i phyir de dag gis ma mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Because the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One withdrew his miraculous power, they did not see it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:🔽“Ānanda, do you see the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya, the buddha realm of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya, and the bodhisattvas and śrāvakas?”

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun mthong ngam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun mthong ngam /
translated: the saṅgha of monks,🔽and the saṅgha of bodhisattvas?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang ma mthong /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang ma mthong /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, I did not see that buddha realm,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de yang ma mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de yang ma mthong /
translated: I did not see that tathāgata,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun de yang ma mthong ;
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun de yang ma mthong ;
translated: I did not see that saṅgha of monks,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun de yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun de yang ma mthong ste /
translated: and I did not see that saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

original: mig lam du yang mi gda'o //
analyzed: mig lam du yang mi gda'o //
translated: They were not visible to the eye.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te /🔽chos la chos snang par mi 'gyur /🔽chos kyis chos mi mthong /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te / chos la chos snang par mi 'gyur / chos kyis chos mi mthong /
translated: “Ānanda, in the same way, all phenomena are not visible to the eye.🔽Phenomena do not appear to phenomena.🔽Phenomena do not see phenomena.

original: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
analyzed: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
translated: Phenomena do not know phenomena.”

original: kun dga' bo ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / nyan thos de dag dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de mig lam du snang bar ma gyur pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / nyan thos de dag dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de mig lam du snang bar ma gyur pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Ānanda, just as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya, those śrāvakas, those individuals belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle, and that buddha-field do not appear in the visual range, in the same way, all phenomena do not appear in the visual range.

original: chos la chos snang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos la chos snang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Phenomena do not appear to phenomena.

original: chos kyis chos mi mthong /
analyzed: chos kyis chos mi mthong /
translated: Phenomena do not see phenomena.

original: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
analyzed: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
translated: Phenomena do not know phenomena.

original: kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni shes pa med pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni shes pa med pa /
translated: Ānanda, all phenomena are without consciousness,

original: mthong ba med pa /🔽byed pa @100a * //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa / byed pa @100a * //
translated: without sight,🔽without action,

original: med pa / bya ba la mthu med pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: med pa / bya ba la mthu med pa sha stag ste /
translated: and without power in their activity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni nam mkha' ltar g-yo ba med pa 'dzin pa med pas byed pa med cing 'dzin pa mid pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni nam mkha' ltar g-yo ba med pa 'dzin pa med pas byed pa med cing 'dzin pa mid pa'o //
translated: Ānanda, all phenomena are like space, without movement, without grasping, without action, and without grasping.

original: kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o ;
analyzed: kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o ;
translated: Ānanda, all phenomena are like illusory people, inconceivable.

original: / kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni sems dang bral zhing rnam par bsgrub pa la so sor gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de snying po med pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: / kun dga' bo chos thams cad ni sems dang bral zhing rnam par bsgrub pa la so sor gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de snying po med pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa'o //
translated: Ānanda, all phenomena are devoid of mind, and they are characterized by being established individually, and they are without feeling because they are without essence.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos gang la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
