translated: He does not become attached to any phenomenon.

original: kun dga' bo de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ste /
translated: Ānanda, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains like this trains in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob par bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to complete all the perfections should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de ltar slob pa ni rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa ni rab ces bya'o //
translated: Those who train in this way are called “supreme.”

original: gtso bo zhes bya'o //🔽mchog ces bya'o //🔽dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya'o // mchog ces bya'o // dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “foremost.”🔽They are called “best.”🔽They are called “excellent.”

original: phul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phul zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “exalted.”

original: gya nom pa zhes bya'o //🔽bla na med pa zhes bya'o //🔽gong na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya'o // bla na med pa zhes bya'o // gong na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “sublime.”🔽They are called “unsurpassed.”🔽They are called “unequaled.”

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “incomparable.”

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “equal to the unequaled.”

original: 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la bde ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la bde ba /
translated: They are the benefactors of the entire world, the ones who bring happiness to the entire world,

original: mgon med pa rnams la mgon du gyur pa /
analyzed: mgon med pa rnams la mgon du gyur pa /
translated: the protectors of those without protection,

original: sangs rgyas kyi snang ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi snang ba /
translated: the light of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa ste /
translated: and the ones praised by the buddhas.

original: de la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di phyag g-yas pas gyen du bteg cing phyir gzhog kyang sems can de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i
analyzed: de la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di phyag g-yas pas gyen du bteg cing phyir gzhog kyang sems can de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i
translated: While abiding in this, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas can lift up this entire world realm of a billion worlds with their right hand and put it back down without the beings there being aware of having been lifted up and put down.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di bteg go zhes bya ba dang gzhog go zhes bya bar mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di bteg go zhes bya ba dang gzhog go zhes bya bar mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is not known that this world system is lifted up or it is put down.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la thogs pa @100b mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyi gzigs pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la thogs pa @100b mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyi gzigs pa grub pa yin te /
translated: Ānanda, the lord buddhas of the past, future, and present have trained in this perfection of wisdom itself and have accomplished the vision of wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to past, future, and present dharmas.

original: kun dga' bo bslab pa gang ji snyed cig yod pa'i bslab pa thams cad kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa ni rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo bslab pa gang ji snyed cig yod pa'i bslab pa thams cad kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa ni rab ces bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, of all the trainings that there are, the training in the perfection of wisdom is called the best.

original: gtso bo zhes bya'o //🔽mchog ces bya'o //🔽dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya'o // mchog ces bya'o // dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the foremost.🔽It is called the highest.

original: phul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phul zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the most excellent.

original: gya nom pa zhes bya'o //🔽bla na med pa zhes bya'o //🔽gong na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya'o // bla na med pa zhes bya'o // gong na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the sublime.🔽It is called the most refined.🔽It is called the unsurpassed.🔽It is called the unequaled.

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the matchless.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //🔽kun dga' bo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshad gzung ba'am /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o // kun dga' bo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshad gzung ba'am /
translated: it is called “equal to the unequalled.”🔽Ānanda, whoever wishes to grasp the measure or

original: mtha' btsal bar 'dod pa ni nam mkha' tshad gzung ba'am /
analyzed: mtha' btsal bar 'dod pa ni nam mkha' tshad gzung ba'am /
translated: seek the limit of the perfection of wisdom is like someone who wishes to grasp the measure or

original: mtha' btsal bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: mtha' btsal bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: seek the limit of space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: kun dga' bo ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma bstan pa med do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma bstan pa med do //
translated: Ānanda, I have not taught a measure for the perfection of wisdom.

original: ming mang po dang / tshig mang po dang 'bru mang po la ni tshad ma dang 'brel pa yod kyi /
analyzed: ming mang po dang / tshig mang po dang 'bru mang po la ni tshad ma dang 'brel pa yod kyi /
translated: There is a connection between a measure and many names, many phrases, and many syllables,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni tshad ma dang 'brel ba med do zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'i rgyu gsum pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni tshad ma dang 'brel ba med do zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'i rgyu gsum pa ste /
translated: but there is no connection between a measure and the perfection of wisdom.” This is the third cause that brings about the attainment of great enlightenment.

original: 'di dag gis ni rgyu gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rgyu gsungs pa yin no /
translated: This is the explanation of the causes.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma dang 'brel pa ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma dang 'brel pa ma mchis pa lags /
translated: Bhagavān, why is the perfection of wisdom not connected with a valid cognition?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: kun dga' bo mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma dang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma dang 'brel pa med do //
translated: Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is not connected with a valid cognition because it is inexhaustible.

original: kun dga' bo dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma dang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma dang 'brel pa med do //
translated: Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is not connected with a valid cognition because it is isolated.

original: kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyin las byung yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyin las byung yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Ānanda, all the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past also arose from this perfection of wisdom, but the perfection of wisdom

original: zad par ma gyur to //
analyzed: zad par ma gyur to //
translated: has not been exhausted.

original: kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin🔽pa zad par 'gyur ba @101a * //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par 'gyur ba @101a * //
translated: Ananda, all the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who will appear in the future will also emerge from this very perfection of wisdom, yet the perfection of wisdom will not be exhausted.

original: med do // kun dga' bo da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma zad do //
analyzed: med do // kun dga' bo da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma zad do //
translated: Ananda, all the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who are at present in the world systems of the ten directions, the Buddhas, the Lords who are teaching the Dharma, they also have emerged from this very perfection of wisdom, yet the perfection of wisdom has not been exhausted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par bya bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' zad par bya bar sems su zad de /
analyzed: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par bya bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' zad par bya bar sems su zad de /
translated: Ananda, he who thinks that the perfection of wisdom is to be exhausted, he thinks that space is to be exhausted.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not exhausted, is not exhausted, will not be exhausted.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of concentration, the perfection of energy, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, the perfection of giving are not exhausted, are not exhausted, will not be exhausted.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature are not exhausted, are not exhausted, will not be exhausted.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the noble eightfold path are not exhausted, are not exhausted now, and will not be exhausted.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
translated: The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the clairvoyances,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are not exhausted, are not exhausted now, and will not be exhausted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not exhausted, are not exhausted, and will not be exhausted.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects is not exhausted, is not exhausted, and will not be exhausted.🔽Since those dharmas do not arise, how could they be exhausted?

original: chos @101b de dag la ni skye ba'ang med na de dag zad par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni zad pa dang skye ba med pa'i byang chub chen po yin no /
analyzed: chos @101b de dag la ni skye ba'ang med na de dag zad par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni zad pa dang skye ba med pa'i byang chub chen po yin no /
translated: This is the great enlightenment that is without exhaustion and without arising.

original: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
analyzed: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
translated: Then the Lord extended his tongue,

original: zhal gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad ljags kyi dbang pos yongs su bkab nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhal gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad ljags kyi dbang pos yongs su bkab nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: and with his tongue covered the entire circle of the assembly and spoke to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Ānanda?

original: lce'i dbang po 'di lta bu dang ldan pa log par smra'am /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po 'di lta bu dang ldan pa log par smra'am /
translated: Would one with such a tongue as this lie?

original: gzhan du smra bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhan du smra bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Would they speak otherwise?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, they would not.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ma lags so ;🔽/ bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ma lags so ; / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Sugata, they would not.”

original: kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'khor bzhi la rgya cher ston cig / brjod cig / sgrogs shig / shod cig / khod cig / rab tu khod cig / khrol cig / rnam par phye shig / gsal par byos
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'khor bzhi la rgya cher ston cig / brjod cig / sgrogs shig / shod cig / khod cig / rab tu khod cig / khrol cig / rnam par phye shig / gsal par byos
translated: The Blessed One said, “Ānanda, therefore teach, recite, proclaim, explain, expound, elucidate, clarify, and reveal this perfection of wisdom extensively to the fourfold assembly.

original: shig / yang dag par ston cig / kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las gang la nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas bslab par bya ba dang /
analyzed: shig / yang dag par ston cig / kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las gang la nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas bslab par bya ba dang /
translated: Ānanda, in this profound perfection of wisdom are taught all the dharmas that those in the vehicle of the hearers, those in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and those in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas should train in.

original: gang la ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bslabs pas rang rang gi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: gang la ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bslabs pas rang rang gi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
translated: In whatever way they train in accordance with the teachings, they will each abide in their respective levels.

original: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni yi ge thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni yi ge thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Ananda, this profound perfection of wisdom is the entrance to all the letters.

original: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'i gzungs thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'i gzungs thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
translated: Ananda, this profound perfection of wisdom is the door of the dhāraṇī gateway, which is the gateway of all the dhāraṇīs in which bodhisattva great beings should train.

original: gzungs 'di 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni spobs pa dang so so yang dag pa'i rig pa'i sgo thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gzungs 'di 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni spobs pa dang so so yang dag pa'i rig pa'i sgo thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro ;
translated: For bodhisattva great beings who hold this dhāraṇī, all the doors of eloquence and correct understanding will manifest.

original: / kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos mi zad pa'i mdzod yin par ngas bshad pa'o //🔽kun dga' bo de bas na khyod mos par bya /
analyzed: / kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos mi zad pa'i mdzod yin par ngas bshad pa'o // kun dga' bo de bas na khyod mos par bya /
translated: Ananda, I explain that this profound perfection of wisdom is the inexhaustible treasure of the sacred Dharma of the past, future, and present buddhas.

original: khong du @102a * //
analyzed: khong du @102a * //
translated: Ananda, therefore you should have conviction in this,🔽you should understand it,

original: chud par bya ste /
analyzed: chud par bya ste /
translated: and

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Whoever takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, and masters this profound perfection of wisdom takes up the awakening of the lord buddhas of the past, future, and present.🔽Ānanda, this is the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom that you should take up, and by taking up which you will take up all dharmas.

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs gang bzung bas chos thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs ngas bstan pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po la yid ches pa'i🔽rgyu gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs gang bzung bas chos thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs ngas bstan pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po la yid ches pa'i rgyu gsungs pa yin no /
translated: This is the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom that I have taught.

original: // / bam po lnga bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga bcu bdun pa /
translated: This is the statement of the cause of confidence in great awakening.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then venerable Subhūti thought this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zab /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zab /
translated: “The perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub kyang zab na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub kyang zab na /
translated: “The enlightenment of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas is profound.

original: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la de 'dri'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la de 'dri'o snyam ste /
translated: I shall ask the Tathā­gata, Arhat, Genuinely Perfect Buddha about this.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi bas pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi bas pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, the transcendent perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: ” The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: “Su­bhūti, the transcendent perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible because space is inexhaustible.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: ” He then asked, “Blessed One, how should one accomplish the transcendent perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor gzugs mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Su­bhūti, one should accomplish the transcendent perfection of wisdom because form is inexhaustible.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because the perfection of giving is inexhaustible.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol @102b tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol @102b tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because inner emptiness is inexhaustible.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: You should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because the applications of mindfulness are inexhaustible.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: You should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished through the imperishability of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,🔽wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished through the imperishability of the tathāgata’s powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, up to the knowledge of all aspects is inexhaustible, so the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, since form is inexhaustible like space, the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor tshor ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor tshor ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, since feeling is inexhaustible like space, the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'du shes nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes @103a * //
analyzed: 'du shes nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes @103a * //
translated: Since perception is inexhaustible like space,

original: pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'du byed rnams nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Because of the inexhaustibility of volitional forces like space, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should complete the perfection of wisdom.🔽Because of the inexhaustibility of consciousness like space, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should complete the perfection of wisdom.🔽Because of the inexhaustibility of the sense-fields like space, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should complete the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor skye mched rnams nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽khams rnams nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor skye mched rnams nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽khams rnams nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Because of the inexhaustibility of the elements like space, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should complete the perfection of wisdom.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o ;
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be practiced by the bodhisattva great beings because dependent origination is inexhaustible like space.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because the perfection of generosity is inexhaustible like space.

original: / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be practiced because the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of internal phenomena, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of external phenomena, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of emptiness, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of great extent, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of ultimate reality, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of the unlimited, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of the observable, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of non-observation, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of inherent existence, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of the absence of inherent existence, which is inexhaustible like space.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub por bya'o ;
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub por bya'o ;
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of the nature of non-entities, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the applications of mindfulness, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: / rab 'byor pa nye bar gzhag pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: / rab 'byor pa nye bar gzhag pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,🔽the branches of enlightenment,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags @103b pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags @103b pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and the noble eightfold path, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished by means of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,🔽wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished by means of the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, up to the knowledge of all aspects is like space, inexhaustible, so the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma rig pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor 'du byed nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma rig pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor 'du byed nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, because ignorance is like space, inexhaustible, the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, because formations are like space, inexhaustible, the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because consciousness is like space, inexhaustible, the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor ming dang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ming dang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because name and form are inexhaustible like space, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor skye mched drug nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor skye mched drug nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because the six sense fields are inexhaustible like space, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor reg pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor reg pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because contact is inexhaustible like space, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor tshor ba nam @104a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor tshor ba nam @104a * //
translated: Subhūti,

original: mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: because feeling is inexhaustible like space, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor sred pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor len pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor srid pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor sred pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor len pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor srid pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because craving is inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor skye ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor skye ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because grasping is inexhaustible like space.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because becoming is inexhaustible like space.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because birth is inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ste //
analyzed: rab 'byor rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ste //
translated: Subhūti, since old age and death, sorrow and lamentation, pain, mental unease, and disturbance are inexhaustible like space, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par blta ba dang / thog ma dang tha ma rnam par spangs par blta ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par blta ba dang / thog ma dang tha ma rnam par spangs par blta ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ view of dependent origination and the view of abandoning the first and last.

original: gang de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying po byang chub la 'dug pa'i ma 'dres pa'i chos te /
analyzed: gang de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying po byang chub la 'dug pa'i ma 'dres pa'i chos te /
translated: Whoever views dependent origination in this way has the unshared quality of a bodhisattva great being sitting at the heart of awakening.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba des ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //🔽rab 'byor gang la la nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub pa 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba des ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ro // rab 'byor gang la la nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub pa 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: That is the bodhisattva great beings’ unique quality of sitting on the terrace of enlightenment, and seeing dependent origination in that way, they attain the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.🔽“Subhūti, those who practice the perfection of wisdom by way of this accomplishment that is like space, and see dependent origination, do not stand on the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level,🔽but stand in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “Subhūti, those who practice the perfection of wisdom by way of this accomplishment that is like space, and see dependent origination, do not stand on the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la @104b gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la @104b gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: but stand in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang phyir ldog pa de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba 'di la ma brten pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par blta bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang phyir ldog pa de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba 'di la ma brten pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par blta bar bya ba dang /
translated: “Subhūti, all those persons who have turned back from the Bodhisattva Vehicle have not relied on this attention to the perfection of wisdom, and so, Subhūti, when they practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not know how to see dependent origination and how to accomplish it by means of the realization that is like space, and so they turn back.

original: mngon par bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pas phyir ldog go / rab 'byor gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa phyir ldog pa de dag thams cad ni thabs mkhas pa 'di lam brten pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las🔽phyir ldog go //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pas phyir ldog go / rab 'byor gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa phyir ldog pa de dag thams cad ni thabs mkhas pa 'di lam brten pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las🔽phyir ldog go //
translated: “Subhūti, all those persons who have turned back from the Bodhisattva Vehicle have turned back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening because they have not relied on this skillful means.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs
translated: “Subhūti, all those bodhisattva great beings who do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening do so by relying on this perfection of wisdom.

original: pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog ste /🔽de ltar thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par blta bar bya ste mngon par
analyzed: pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog ste / de ltar thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par blta bar bya ste mngon par
translated: They do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means should see the perfection of wisdom as something to be accomplished like space, as something that cannot be exhausted, and should accomplish it.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par blta bas ni chos gang yang rgyu med pa las byung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par blta bas ni chos gang yang rgyu med pa las byung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings look at dependent origination, they do not see any dharma that has arisen without a cause.

original: chos gang yang skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos gang yang skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see any dharma that arises.

original: chos gang yang 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos gang yang 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see any dharma that ceases.

original: chos gang yang bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang /
analyzed: chos gang yang bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang /
translated: They do not see any dharma as a self, a sentient being, a life-force, a person, an individual, a human, a human being, an agent, an instigator,

original: slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / lta ba por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / lta ba por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: a feeler, a knower, or a viewer.

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag @105a * //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag @105a * //
translated: permanent, impermanent, happy, suffering, self,🔽and selflessness.

original: med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: nor as permanent, nor as impermanent, nor as ease, nor as suffering, nor as self, nor as not self, nor as calm, nor as not calm.

original: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom in that way, they should view dependent origination.
